source: カーターに電話した時に お前は一線を超えた デビッドソンの殺人で 私に目を向けさせようとした
target: You crossed a line when you made that call to Carter, pointing her towards me in the Davidson murder.

source: ゲームに目を向けながら. . 老人の複雑な心境で
target: Making the tour of the prison before he left and looking on at a game of skittles with the mixed feelings of an old inhabitant who had his private reasons for believing that it might be his destiny to come back again."

source: まぁ 今は君達２人に 疑いの目を向けている
target: Well, he did find that book, and he is paying attention to her and to you.

source: 真実に目を向けるために 目を開かせるのだ
target: That's why I have to open your eyes to the truth.

source: コサックは目を塞がれてきた その結果彼らの大部分は 俺達に反対している
target: If we don't arrest the most active enemies now, they'll rebel again.

source: すぐに、君の目を奪う 盲目の女が地下で 生存することは出来ない
target: We take your eyes now... and see how long a blind girl can survive in the basement.

source: 部門の防犯カメラの の映像を引き出した メタモルフ薬品のバンが 私の目を引いた
target: I pulled up the department's security camera footage, and a van from Metamorpho Chemical caught my eye.

source: 警官殺しは　とても注目を引く クーパーが不正をしたことに
target: The murder of a cop draws a lot of heat, so dirtying Cooper up is one way to deflect it.

source: それで絵の構成に 彼を中心に据え 見る人の目を 引きたいと思っています
target: So just like this spider, I built my web, hoping to catch the viewer's eye.

source: ♪人目を引いて 注目を浴びるの
target: # I'm gonna make a scene I'm gonna make a fuss

source: お前に目を掛けている
target: He cares about you.

source: 私、私の目を欺くか？
target: Do my eyes deceive me?

source: 俺の目を欺くことは出来ないぞ お前が化けても
target: You can't bluff my eyes with your disguise

source: びっくり仰天 わが目を疑う出し物
target: ...is presenting to you something you will absolutely refuse to believe!

source: - いや、もう自分の目を疑ったよね。
target: I was like, pinching myself while I was hooking up with her. -No!

source: 目を疑いたくなるような 不可解なものを
target: I mean, hell, half the stuff, we wouldn't have believed it ourselves had we not seen it together.

source: 僕の目を盗んでは 古い地図に見入ってる
target: He spends hours and hours poring over old maps when he thinks I'm not looking.

source: 君のママがその指を見て 手を洗いなさいって言うけど それでもママの目を盗んで その指舐めたりしてさ
target: And your mom probably told you to wash your hands, but I bet you'd just lick it off when she wasn't looking.

source: 下女ごときが　人目を盗んで
target: A servant secretly lighting lanterns in her room!

source: 兄弟の罪に目を瞑った
target: She turned a blind eye to her brother's sins.

source: 俺は職務を果たすぞ 目を瞑って　奴がシアトルで捕まるのを 期待するのが最善とは思えん
target: I'll do my job myself, instead of praying they catch him in Seattle!

source: うしろめたさから逃れるために そのことから目を背け
target: And every time I walked away from something I wanted to forget

source: 目を背けるな
target: Don't turn away.

source: 問題から目を背けさせるため 民衆の注意を引くのが仕事だ
target: From now on, your job is to be a distraction. So people forget what the real problems are.

source: 目を覆うんだ　ナンシー 見てほしくない
target: Cover your eyes, Nancy. I don't want you watching this.

source: 目を覆って ♪ welcome to the machine ♪ ♪ where have you been ♪
target: Cover your eyes. _ ?

source: 目を覆っても 見えるって分かる?
target: You do know I can see through this?

source: 自伝を書かせてるが これは 目を見張るほどの 出来だ
target: It's a simple autobiography and then I get this amazing piece.

source: 目を見張った！
target: It is spectacular!

source: 目を見張る忍耐力だ
target: You show remarkable grit for a teacher.

source: booを開く場合、クソ彼と一緒に座って目を覚ます。
target: Boo wakes up, you fucking sit up with him.

source: グレゴリーが目を覚ました 話がしたいって
target: Gregory's up.

source: 目を覚ますまで 壁を揺すってやる
target: And I will shake your walls until you wake.

source: 毎晩、私は目を覚ました、 冷や汗をかいて 怯え、そして孤独だった
target: Every night, I would wake up in a cold sweat, frightened and alone.

source: - これに目を通したら、
target: - Look through that,

source: 目を通して　たのむよ
target: Come on, you'll see. Please.

source: 「我々は、報告書に全て目を通し、 頭に叩き込んだ」
target: We've done a briefing book, so read up.

source: - 目を逸らすな
target: - Don't look away.

source: 目を逸らさなかった。
target: I didn't look away.

source: だが今は、誰か死ぬのに目を逸らすか、 解決するか選ぶんだ。
target: But you can look away now when someone else dies, or you can help solve this.

source: 盗みに目を配らなきゃならないけどね
target: You've gotta watch out for the stealing.

source: 財務を建て直し 研究にも目を配っている
target: Not only in keeping our finances in order, but overseeing a good amount of product research.

source: ダリルと外出するから― ハーシェル達に 目を配ってくれ
target: When I'm out with Daryl, help Hershel keep an eye on things around here.

source: 目を開かせるのです 足ではなく・・
target: - We opens their eyes not their legs.

source: 遅かれ早かれ目を開くわ
target: Sooner or later, you will open those eyes.

source: おぃ、彼から目を離すな、 ここを去ろうとするなら、私に知らせろ
target: Hey. Watch him well. let me know.

source: 彼から絶対に目を離さないで下さい ミセスドレークの後を追う間
target: I'll keep an eye on him while you follow Mrs. Drake.

source: おい　お前もだ 目を離すな
target: Hey -- you, too. Keep an eye on him.

source: 私はスターラボが地域・社会のために、何が出来るか考えていた。 多分、もう人々はDr. ウェルズに対して それほど目くじらを立てていないだろう。
target: I thought if Star Labs could do something nice for the community, maybe people wouldn't be so angry at Doctor Wells anymore.

source: - なんで、そんなに目くじらを立てる
target: Do you understand that?

source: 実に目先が利くな
target: Astute, actually.

source: 目先を変えて お互いに親切にしても 良かったかもね
target: Maybe we could be kind to one another for a change, huh?

source: 選挙のことから 少し目先を変えて― かぼちゃ大王の話をします
target: And, as a change of pace, rather than campaign talk I've decided to say a few words about the Great Pumpkin.

source: どうして黙って目先を変えないの？
target: Why don't you just shut up for a change?

source: 目処が付くまで捜査する 私が疑われる つまり私達全員が
target: Until they close it, their focus could turn to me, which means us.

source: ナンシー パリで目星を付けた女
target: Nancy, okay, you know the woman I spotted in Paris, the bomber?

source: 目玉が飛び出るほど高かったけど 18の誕生日だったから...
target: It was outrageously expensive, but it was her 18th birthday, so...

source: なるほど ったく相変わらず頑固だな
target: Still the same old Frank, huh?

source: 相変わらず兄上は 権力の掌握が大事なのね 兄弟の救出よりも
target: As usual, your power grabs are more important than rescuing your brother.

source: でも彼は相変わらず 時計のネジを巻き続けている
target: But there's you every day winding that stupid watch.

source: 相変わらず口が悪くて よかった
target: I'm glad to see you still have your twisted sense of humor.

source: 僕らの血液の相性が悪いと 君は死ぬことになる
target: If our blood is incompatible, you could die.

source: 相性が悪いと言われて... 里親にね。
target: - Said I wasn't a good fit.

source: - 中佐、ウィルスは炭素ベースの生命体とは相性が悪いんです
target: Commander, the virus is incompatible with carbon-based life.

source: そりゃ　相談に乗ってもらったり 力を借りることはあるけど→ できる限り　自分でやらなきゃって 思ってるの。
target: That is, by consulting with you, I enlist your help but as much as I can, I believe I must do it myself.

source: あの　ドレスについて相談に 乗ってくれるって言ってたわよね
target: Hey, you said you wanted to help me with my dress.

source: 相談に乗ると電話番号を俺に
target: Why you slipped me your number in case I ever need to ask anything?

source: あの人ったら 固まって眉一つ動かさないの
target: He didn't dare raise an eyebrow.

source: 真に受けていない
target: Don't be an ass.

source: あの女の言うことなど 真に受けるな
target: Oh, for christ's sake. How many times I got to tell you, that woman is crazy, Larry.

source: 奴らの言うことを 真に受けちゃだめだ... 地獄みてぇに 狂わされるからな
target: They say they try to get you straight... but they make you crazier than hell.

source: そうさ... 教皇の話は 真に迫る
target: Yeah, well, the Pope tells it like it really is.

source: そして　完全な被害者だ 私　真に迫っていたわよね？
target: I was so believable today, wasn't I?

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だった
target: It was a big lie.

source: 入局して 真っ赤な嘘だと分かったよ
target: I wish someone had told me it is a total lie.

source: それは真っ赤な嘘だ
target: That is an outright lie.

source: だがホッブズさんよ 俺達は "眠れる獅子" なんだよ
target: But I can assure you, Mr. Hobbes, we're a sleeping giant.

source: 時間の不変性を冒せば 矛盾が生じるでしょ？
target: Well, if you mess with the consistency of time, you create a paradox, right?

source: ですがキャリー マティソンの 補記と矛盾
target: Yet Carrie Mathison's addendum to your file contradicts that.

source: お前は矢面に立ってる... しかし　そうすべきではない
target: Putting yourself in the firing line is no way of dealing with it.

source: 私はお前の馬鹿さの矢面に立つ
target: I have to bear the brunt of your idiocies.

source: お前が 矢面に立ってくれた
target: You were more often in the line of fire.

source: 知らぬが仏だよ
target: What they don't know won't hurt 'em.

source: 知らぬが仏って事もある
target: Well, sometimes what we don't know doesn't hurt us, right?

source: 知らぬが仏 だ
target: Ignorance is bliss.

source: 知らぬ存ぜぬでもいいが まだまだ先は長いぞ
target: I can play this game All day long.

source: 知る人ぞ知る ルイス・ル・プリンスは 悪魔だったという話しさ
target: The legend is only something people in the know would know... that Louis Le Prince was the Devil.

source: 孫は　知る由もない 白人貧困層が　父であること
target: My grandson will never know that piece of white trash is his father.

source: ２人だと知恵が回る
target: When working, it gets us nothing!

source: 犯罪者の誰もが　知恵が回るわけじゃない
target: Not everyone's a criminal mastermind.

source: みんなが問題を 解決して欲しくて... あなたの知恵を借りに来るって 誇らしい気分でしょうね 何かトラブルを起こすんじゃないかと 思われてるよりも
target: It must be nice to have everyone always looking to you for answers to their problems instead of waiting for you to cause a problem.

source: 戦争に勝利した今 先人の知恵を借りる時だ
target: Now that the war is won, we should all find time for wisdom.

source: 兄さんも父さんも 知恵を絞ったけど――
target: No! Steve and Dad wracked their brains, - but they said it's impossible.

source: 知恵を絞るんだな
target: I have faith in your resourcefulness.

source: 何 怒ってんだよ お前 短気は損気だよ お前
target: What're you getting all pissed off about?

source: 一石二鳥だ
target: All in one fell swoop.

source: 机を叩けば一石二鳥です
target: Tapping the table kills both birds with one stone.

source: 一石二鳥と 言う事で
target: I've always wanted to visit Disneyland. Two birds with one stone, as they say.

source: 破天荒な人生を送ってきた.
target: I lived my wild life.

source: 分離主義者の戦艦マレヴォレンス 共和国の領域に破竹の勢いで進んで、 どんな船に出会っても、 引っかきまわす
target: The Separatist battleship Malevolence advances unopposed to Republic space, tearing apart any ship that stands in its path.

source: 彼が近くに来るといつも 君の態度が少し硬くなる
target: Your posture stiffens subtly whenever he gets close. I'm pretty sure it doesn't.

source: その日、ヤツが 埋葬した死体が 現在の我々の基礎を 築いたのだ
target: The bodies he buried that day laid the foundation of what we are now.

source: 彼女は数ヶ月の間に、今回の買収の 基礎を築いていました
target: She's been laying the foundation for this takeover for months.

source: ソフトウェアデザインチームの リーダー その人のお父上もまた ＥＮＣＯＭ社に多大な貢献をし 本日の基礎を築きました
target: The head of our software design team, a man whose father's own notable history with ENCOM helped make this company what it is today.

source: あなたは少し礼を失している
target: For the same reason you're not. It's the way I was brought up.

source: 礼を失する
target: It means rude, disrespectful.

source: 礼を失するのでは? お前の家で眠っている男を撃つために
target: You know, it's not considered polite to shoot a man who's sleeping in your house.

source: 奴を捕らえたら祝杯を上げよう
target: There'll be plenty of time for celebrating after we get Nazir.

source: 祝杯を上げよう
target: I want to make a toast.

source: 君はホードーの精神に入った
target: You got inside Hodor's mind.

source: ジマーマンは 神経が高ぶってた
target: Zimmerman was a man on the edge.

source: 神経が高ぶってるのかも
target: Maybe I'm getting all worked up over nothing.

source: 神経が高ぶるか？
target: Is it the trip? It's got you nervous?

source: 神経を使わないのだろう
target: Maybe she's just asleep.

source: 私としたことが...
target: What I am doing?

source: コウノトリが巻きついてるなんて クソにも程がある
target: I hate that fucking thing too. A stork wrapped around a tree branch. That's the stupidest thing I've ever seen.

source: 誰でもいいわ 冗談にも程がある
target: Okay, whoever's in there, this is majorly unfunny.

source: 私とジョフリーが結婚し次第　種を蒔く
target: I'll plant the seed as soon as Joffrey and I are married.

source: おぃ　アナルに穴が空くだろ！
target: Ow! Asshole, that hurt! - Yeah, that was the point!

source: あんな天才はいない 心に大きな穴が開いたようだ
target: He had such life, you know? Such a talent. It's a big hole.

source: 外装に穴が開いてしまいー
target: It could cause a hole to be melted into the exterior.

source: 穴が開いてる
target: Holes. Hmm.

source: 心の穴を埋めて...
target: Fill some crater in your soul?

source: 私の心の 穴を埋めてくれる何かが
target: ♪ Something to fill this hole inside.

source: 皆も気付いていたが 昨晩　バリーの従妹が 穴を埋めてくれて はっきりしたよ
target: We all noticed it, and it got real clear last night after Barry's cousin filled in.

source: ニックはプライベートジェットを使う 私は民間航空を使う
target: Nick's taking a small plane. I'm flying commercial.

source: 私と彼との経緯は　ご存知でしょう そして　彼の導き出す推理が 突拍子も無いことも
target: You know my history with the guy, and now you see that some of the theories he comes up with can be pretty out there, and I just don't think he'll be a good fit around here.

source: 突拍子もないとは思うけど 時間差の説明は　つくわね
target: It sounds crazy, but it would explain the time gap.

source: 突拍子もないニュースが沢山ある
target: There is all kinds of crazy news people out here.

source: サイロンの攻撃から隠れるための 窮余の策だ、違うか？ last -ditch effort　窮余の一策
target: Last ditch effort to hide from the Cylon attack, right?

source: 私は立往生していた...
target: I felt stranded...

source: ( 国境が閉鎖され航空機は飛べず 旅行者は立往生しています)
target: Borders are closed and flights have been grounded, stranding millions of travelers.

source: しかし 大勢のアメリカ人が 立往生している
target: But there are a lot of Americans stuck there.

source: 立ち往生してる様だから 兄を見つけたい
target: You seem to be stuck with this place and I want to find my brother.

source: 立ち往生された
target: Weesa going nowhere.

source: 彼は、メロンの立ち往生した。
target: He's got his melon stuck.

source: 我々としても立つ瀬がない
target: We feel humiliated.

source: 私の立場がなくない？
target: You're kind of making me look bad.

source: 避けてたのに 立場が無いよ
target: I don't know, maybe this is my fault. Maybe I'm missing something here.

source: 君は21歳のはずだ 奴らは立場がなくなる
target: You gotta be 21. They'll lose their license.

source: 最高議長 元老院の方々 悲劇が起きました 交易ルートの関税問題に 端を発し...
target: Supreme Chancellor, delegates of the senate, a tragedy has occurred... which started right here with the taxation of trade routes... and has now engulfed our entire planet... in the oppression of the Trade Federation.

source: これは 俺が端を発している
target: This is on me.

source: 毒ベリーに端を発した
target: A problem that began the moment you revealed those poison berries in the arena.

source: わたしはラマ・ブラックバーンの竹馬の友だぞ
target: I'm Lamar Blackburn's oldest friend.

source: - 笑いが止まらなかったよ
target: He kept making me laugh.

source: 笑いが止まらないって 経験ある？
target: Have you ever had that feeling when you can't stop smiling?

source: パレスチナの問題は 笑い事ではない
target: We do not consider the issue of Israel and Palestine a laughing matter.

source: 今のところ、しかし笑い事ではないの cuz我々は我々は彼を忘れてしまった。
target: It's not so funny now, though cuz we forgot where we put him.

source: お前はラニスター軍の誰よりも筋がいい
target: You have better instincts than any officer in the Lannister army.

source: お前は筋がいい
target: You have good instincts.

source: なぜ筋を通さなかった？
target: Show him what's what?

source: 俺たちは筋を通す
target: You see, we're reasonable people.

source: そこで 私が筋を通し 和解を申し出れば 伯父上も受け入れて 下さることでしょう
target: I flatter myself that my overtures of goodwill are highly commendable, and will not lead you to reject the offered olive branch.

source: 筋金入りの人達がいるから
target: There's some hardcore haters out there.

source: 君の勇気は筋金入りだ
target: Your courage is legendary.

source: 「これ以上話す前に、以下の予防策を 講じる様、どうかご同意ください」
target: "extremely high-risk, and you are willing to agree "to the following precautions before I share more.

source: 質問は どのような対策を 講じるか です
target: My question is, what do you plan there to do?

source: 私は安全策を講じる マスコミを利用する すべて仕組まれたことだと
target: And when you do, I will read about it from a secure location, and I will reintroduce myself to society at that time.

source: 小男の下で精を出して 働く意味は分かる
target: I know what it is to toil beneath lesser men.

source: 明らかに 財産作りに精を出している
target: Trying to make a legacy for herself.

source: 地域の表看板役に 精を出してる
target: Takes that job very seriously.

source: 糞食らえ　ドワーフ
target: Eat shit, dwarf.

source: 伝統なんて糞食らえだ
target: Fuck kneeling and fuck oaths.

source: - 数など糞食らえ
target: Fuck the math.

source: 糠喜びさせたくは無いが かなり良い所まで来たと思う
target: Now, I don't want anyone living in a fool's paradise, but I would say we're in pretty good shape for our first preview tonight.

source: 糸を引く者が居る筈よ
target: Castle, whoever is behind this,

source: 裏でVが糸を引いてる気が
target: I got a feeling the V's are somehow in the middle of all this.

source: ボスは上層を守るために 糸を引いている所だ
target: My boss is pulling strings right now to save the upper management.

source: 覚えておいて カワイイ子とキモい子 その差は紙一重
target: Just remember, there's a fine line between cute and creepy.

source: 雑談どころか 議論と紙一重です
target: Do you call that a debate? Since the beginning your comments have been controversial !

source: 人種差別者と紙一重
target: On the verge of being racist!

source: まぁ　終わりよければ　すべてよし　だろ？
target: Hey, all's well that ends well, though, right?

source: 「終わりよければ　すべてよし」でしょ？
target: All's well that ends well, right?

source: そうするくらいなら お前は終止符を打つ
target: If you did, you'd put a stop to all this.

source: (記者)いやー｡ 絵になりますね｡ さすが チョコレート王子｡
target: - Yes. Wow, it's as pretty as a picture. As expected of the prince of chocolate.

source: 絵になる場面だぜ ベイビー " 神様 いる？
target: There's the money shot, baby.

source: 絵に描いたような妻は？ 幸せそうに笑う 俺のかわいい子供たちはどこだ？
target: Where's my gift-wrapped Norman Rockwell wife, and my beautiful, happy, smiling children?

source: 僕はギリギリの綱渡りをしているんだ、
target: But I'm walking a fine line right now.

source: シマンスキーは操作網を張ったわよ そろそろ何してるか教えて
target: Szymanski's got a dragnet out for your hit man. I suggest you steer clear for a while.

source: 線を引いてそれに制限を設けると 小便とばし大会を開くことになると主張するよ。
target: I would argue drawing a line might encourage a pissing contest.

source: 親子の縁を切るの
target: A full parental divorce.

source: またあんな格好したら 縁を切るぞ
target: I will disown you if you ever don those tie-dyed pants again.

source: お前との縁を切るぞ。
target: I will cut you off.

source: 縁起でもないこと言うなよ
target: Don't talk like that!

source: 縁起でもない　そんなに長生きして　どうする
target: Nonsense! I don't want to live that long.

source: まだ10: 35だ 私は縁起を担ぐのでね
target: It is now 10:35 p.m. and I'm very superstitious.

source: このホテルの最上階に 政権移行チームと缶詰になり 書類を読み、打ち合わせを 行っており...
target: The top two floors of the Intercontinental, where she's huddled with her transition team poring over briefing books, taking meetings...

source: 僕と違って 妹には罪がない
target: I'll die. I should. But my sister never did anything to you.

source: ええ テロリストが 秘密の通路を作って― こっちに罪を着せようとしたのよ 引っ越しくらいしないとね
target: Yeah, well, when a terrorist builds a secret passageway into your apartment and frames you for mass murder, burning a little sage doesn't really cut it.

source: 私に罪を着せないで
target: Don't yöu blame this on me.

source: 彼女を殺した後　自分の技能を使って カール・レズニックに罪を着せようとしたのか？
target: And after you killed her, that's when you decided to use your skills to frame Carl Resnick?

source: あんた美人局か？
target: Are you her pimp?

source: 羽を伸ばすか
target: Think i might stay a while.

source: シスコに来ると みんな羽目を外すから
target: Why does everybody come to San Francisco and tear loose?

source: 習うは一生ですか？
target: How I need to live and learn?

source: 習うより慣れろ それしかないわ
target: Wake him up and dress him, Miss Evans. There's no better way to learn than by doing.

source: 習うより慣れろよ
target: Practice makes perfect.

source: 老婆心ながら言わせてもらう
target: Let me give you a little advice, Eileen.

source: 見たところ 育ちが良くて あこがれたんでしょうけど 老婆心で言うと
target: Look, you seem like a nice girl, and I'm sure joining a carnival looks like a lot of fun, but let me just tell you right now, you do not want to be here.

source: 耳が早いな
target: Already?

source: 耳が痛いよ
target: Don't gloat.

source: 今じゃすっかり 耳が遠くなってね カーソン宅って聞こえたが
target: Now, my ears aren't what they used to be, but I swear I could have heard you say something about the Carson place.

source: 父は内気でね 同郷の人がいれば 耳が遠くても うまくやれるかと...
target: My dad's kind of shy and it'd be nice to have people around with something in common, besides hearing loss.

source: そうよ　悪魔よ 耳が遠いの？
target: Yes! Demons. Are you deaf?

source: ケヴィン いろんな話を耳にし― 俺に関するデタラメを 山ほど読むだろう
target: Kevin, you're gonna hear and you're gonna fuckin' read a lotta bullshit about me.

source: さて　此奴の事を何か 耳にしたら
target: Well, if you hear of anything about this guy, just...

source: そういうことなら, 私がふと耳にしたとても面白いちょっとしたゴシップを あなたに伝えることができなくなりますね。
target: Then I couldn't tell you the juicy bit of gossip I overheard.

source: 我が君 あなた様のご消息が ちらとでも耳に入っていれば―
target: My Lord, had I detected any sign, a whisper of your whereabouts...

source: ある話が耳に入り始めた スターリング市の自警団
target: I started hearing tales of the Starling City vigilante.

source: それ自分で言うから いい話が 耳に入って来なくなるのよ
target: When you say it like that, I become deaf to any good parts of your story.

source: 私には何のことだか クレア・ウィリアムズが無事だったことを お耳に入れておいた方が
target: Well, I don't yet know you well enough to ask this but you haven't seemed yourself lately.

source: 一つお耳に入れておきたい事が
target: Sir, there's something you should know.

source: ストイック 今　小耳に挟んだ 一部の連中が "策は　あるのか?"と
target: Listen, Stoick, I was overhearing some of the men and, well, some of them are wondering what it is we're up to here.

source: でも　彼が誘因だと小耳に挟んだ あなたが最高だと話してる
target: But I overheard him on plenty of occasions telling other people that you're the best.

source: お前が言った事で 俺の耳に残ったのは お前が死ぬと言うことだけだ
target: Yeah, you see, the only thing you've said that went into my ear was that you die.

source: 耳に残る曲だな
target: I think the tune is rather catchy.

source: 耳を傾けろ、よく聞け
target: So you listen to me and you listen well.

source: サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング サム･ワトソン ヘイモン･ボクシング ヘイモンの話に耳を傾け 彼と相談しながら
target: He listens to Al Haymon.

source: あなたの言うことに 耳を傾けてよかった
target: I really did listen to you, so I'm happy to hear that it

source: 私が君だったら 耳を塞ぐだろうな。
target: I think I'd cover my ears if I were you.

source: 耳を澄ますんだ
target: I keep my ears open.

source: 国民国家が まだ考えるとは耳を疑う 彼らはどんな影響でも与える 協力においてさえ
target: Hard to believe that Nation States still think they have any influence, even in cooperation.

source: まるでヤクザね 耳を疑うわ
target: You're just like a yakuza. I can't believe what I'm hearing.

source: 彼らも同様に耳を疑っていました
target: I gave them your reason for calling off the air strike, but I must warn you, they were skeptical as well.

source: - 耳を貸さないのです
target: - doesn't always listen.

source: これは耳を貸さなくていい
target: Now, that is you being stubborn.

source: 俺に耳を貸したことか？
target: Was it straying from Gellar and listening to me?

source: 聞き捨てならないことを
target: I was distracted by the sound of good police work.

source: - 聞き捨てならないですな！
target: - Now, see here...

source: 聞き捨てならないね
target: Excuse me.

source: 小鳥が聞き耳を立てている では　こちらが笛を吹く！
target: No sound! He's waiting for me. Well, here goes!

source: 散歩ですよ　若い女性に 聞き耳を立てながらね
target: Oh, just wandering the streets and eavesdropping on lovely young ladies.

source: 私の合図を待て 聞き耳を立てて
target: Be ready to move on my signal, and stay sharp.

source: 肌身離さず
target: It's all I managed to save.

source: こいつは 肝が据わってんだよ （馬場園）そうなんですよ
target: She gets what's going on.

source: お前は肝が据わってる
target: You're a badass. You're not scared of shit.

source: 肝を冷やしたぜ！
target: Cold, my ass!

source: 肝に銘じるんだ
target: Careful.

source: 肝に銘じる
target: - I will, definitely.

source: 肝に銘じるよ
target: I gotta work on that.

source: 王子は世界を股に掛けてる
target: The prince is a global guy.

source: 我々が立ち上がるか倒れるかは お前の肩に掛かっているんだ
target: We rise or fall on your shoulders.

source: ♪肩と肩を並べて 立ち上がるんだ
target: ♫ Shoulder to shoulder, we're gonna stand

source: パイクの紋章です あの日、肩を並べて戦いましたな
target: The siege of Pyke. We fought side by side one afternoon.

source: 我々みんなの事です 一緒に肩を並べて立っていた
target: We stood together, shoulder to shoulder, like a town should in times like these.

source: まあ　肩を持つ訳じゃないが つまり　そのコードは...
target: I mean, look, I'm not defending the man or nothing like that, it's just, those codes, they...

source: けじめをつけないとね キミは肩を持つべきだ
target: You have to draw a line, you have to back it up.

source: もっと私の肩を持って 失望ばかりしてないでよ
target: Uh, I'd like you to have my back and stop being so goddamn disappointing like everybody else.

source: ‐無茶よ ‐肩を貸すよ
target: - What? Babe, no! - Come on, I'll help you.

source: 肩を貸すよ。 泣いても舐めてもいい。
target: You know, if you need a shoulder to cry on or just to nibble on...

source: いつも そばにいて― 優しい言葉と温かい食事 泣く時は肩を貸してくれました
target: She was always there with a kind word and a hot meal and a shoulder to cry on.

source: 判事は　どっちに肩入れすると思う？
target: Guess we'll find out in the morning.

source: 何で そこまで 羽根専務に肩入れするんだ？
target: Why is he going that far to back up Director Hane?

source: それから　こんなふうに 柵を背にして撃ったのか？
target: Got up against the railing like this?

source: 抜け出せない 再びロープを背にした
target: It doesn't seem to help, because Atom is backed up against the ropes again.

source: 初心に戻り 前を向くのか 背を向けるのか ハッキリしろよ
target: Here is your chance to kick open that closet door... and do some of that world changing.

source: エーブルは　ユダヤ人 つまり　彼女は結婚する時に 自分の一族に背を向けた
target: Abel there is Jewish, which means she turned her back on her entire clan to get married.

source: そして僕は逃げ出した 昨日までのすべてに背を向けて まるで転げ落ちるみたいに
target: And then I ran away, turning my back on my entire past, as though tumbling down

source: この惑星に背中を向けて... 彼方に ...去って行くしかない
target: Only that I've got my back against the planet... and I'm on my way away.

source: 背水の陣だな
target: - A precipice in front, and wolves behind.

source: ああ　そう 胸が一杯になりませんでした？
target: Oh, yeah. Who didn't get choked up at that?

source: 胸が張り裂ける
target: It's heartbreaking.

source: 胸が張り裂けそう
target: Heartbreaking.

source: ［容疑が晴れて　ほっとしましたが］ ［ネル・ソランジュを失くして 胸が張り裂けるような思いです］
target: As, uh, relieved as I am that the charges were dropped, my heart breaks for Nell Solange.

source: でも 胸が痛まないのか?
target: But does it hurt you?

source: 驚くほど胸が痛まない
target: I feel surprisingly Okay about it.

source: 打ち明けるまで 胸が痛んだ
target: My stomach's been in knots just thinking about telling you.

source: 胸が裂けそうだ
target: My lungs are on fire.

source: 本当に胸が詰まった
target: Man, it was, like, emotional.

source: - 胸が躍るね
target: - Interesting.

source: レイモンド・タスクは... 胸が躍る妙案です
target: I think Raymond Tusk is an exciting, bold idea.

source: どれ程胸が高鳴ってるか あなたが持って来たもの関して
target: I can't tell you how excited I am about what you've brought to us.

source: そりゃいい　胸が高鳴るな！
target: Holy shit! That would be so uplifting.

source: 思い出を胸に刻み 我々の友を讃えよう セドリックは思いやりに溢れ
target: You remember that and we'll celebrate a boy who was kind and honest and brave and true, right to the very end.

source: 皆がその言葉を胸に刻んだ
target: Exactly what these people needed to hear.

source: 胸に秘めた夢が－ 最も切実なー
target: You must know that your innermost wishes will be made real here.

source: そうであっても 胸に秘めてるんだ
target: If they are, they're keeping it to themselves.

source: 自分の胸に秘めて でも 死ぬほど苦しくなった
target: I just... swallowed it, all of it, until it filled me up, and I was drowning in it.

source: ダービーに勝って 胸を張って帰ろう
target: Can't wait till you win this Derby, so we can go home.

source: 君が死を前に胸を張ろうと 泣き叫ぼうとー
target: Whether you're gonna walk like a man or cry like a pussy on your way to the death house.

source: 胸を張って家に帰れる
target: You can enter your house fully justified.

source: 母さんが 最も胸を打たれるだろう
target: Your mother would have been most impressed.

source: 私は胸を打たれた　このバカとは 永遠に親友だと思った 私は やっとの思いで 感情を抑えた
target: I felt like embracing him as family... but then I controlled my emotions

source: 歌の意味がこの胸を焦がす！
target: Sweet tidings! Joyful anguish sears my heart!

source: 山の向こうの息子について語るとき 胸を痛めた
target: His heart hurt when he spoke about a boy beyond the Great Mountains.

source: 他の人間だったら 私達は来ることに胸を痛めて いないだろう
target: If it were anyone else, we wouldn't have troubled ourselves to come.

source: 期待に胸を躍らせていた―
target: Full of promise.

source: 奴等は 胸糞が悪い
target: They are fucking disgusting.

source: 分かっていることはドブネズミを見ると、 胸糞が悪くなるということだけです。
target: All you know is you find them repulsive.

source: 脇が甘く悪人だと気づけなかった兄弟に 自分の国民を渡してしまうのは？
target: To abandon his subjects to an evil that he was too gullible to recognize?

source: 脇目も振らずあの娘の元へ．．．
target: She went straight for him.

source: 動脈を取ってください。
target: You must've nicked an artery.

source: その30分後に、 あなたはニックの動脈を取ることになる
target: 30 minutes after that, you will nick his left anterior descending artery.

source: ヘイゼルとリチャードは ２人にふさわしい脚光を浴びるのよ
target: Hazel and Richard are gonna get the attention they deserve.

source: 脚光を浴びるのが嫌らしい
target: Why? I think she's afraid of being in the limelight.

source: どうも腑に落ちない
target: Something's off.

source: 腑に落ちない
target: I don't know, Castle.

source: 何か腑に落ちない ヘリコプターは着陸しようとしてる どうするの？
target: Something doesn't add up. We're dealing with a copycat. What do you mean, the chopper's about to touch down?

source: それでこそ 我々の腕が上がる
target: And that is where our training kicks in.

source: 腕が立つな
target: You're a capable man.

source: 奴ら腕が立つから 放っといたら大変な事になる
target: It would have created a huge problem just to let those skilled men run around freely.

source: よく腕が立つもんだ
target: How'd you get so good?

source: で　復讐のために ハッキングの腕を磨いたのか？
target: So, did you ever consider using your hacking skills to get revenge?

source: どうやって腕を磨いた？
target: So how is it that you wind up where you've ended up?

source: 違う　腕を磨いてるんだわ
target: No... they're gonna put their skills to work.

source: 結婚すると、腰が据わる」
target: Married guy is more stable.

source: 給油所でなんか始めた さあ　腰を上げろ
target: Activity at the petrol station. Come on, get your arse up.

source: 先週　ケイ・アルフォンソは 階段から落ちて腰を折ったの
target: Last week Kay Alfonso fell, and she broke her hip.

source: 腰を抜かすわ
target: You'd run from here in terror.

source: 水の上まで歩けたら、奴らも腰を抜かすだろうな。
target: If we can walk on the water, they wouldn't dare shoot at us.

source: しっかり腰を据えて 働いておくれ
target: Sit your ass down and get yourself to work.

source: 腰を据える
target: Settle in.

source: 諜報部からの連絡では 夜のうちに 北ベトナム軍は撤退 川向うに腰を据えたらしい
target: Intelligence passed the word down that during the night the NVA had pulled out of our area to positions across the Perfume River.

source: 誰もがディナーのために腰を落ち着ける。
target: Everybody's settling in for dinner.

source: ゆっくり腰を落ち着けて デザートを食べる時間もあるじゃないか？
target: So does this mean that you can actually sit down and have some dessert?

source: どの星に 腰を落ち着けるかな
target: Any thoughts on where I should set up shop?

source: （吉森） 一人前に扱われないのは 腹が立つが それはいつものことだ 今に始まったことじゃねえー
target: Not being able to handle an adult makes one angry but... That's normal., It's not the first time...

source: あなたは　腹が立って 裏切られたとさえ思ったでしょうね
target: You must have felt angry, betrayed, even.

source: 〈腹が立った〉
target: Mostly pissed off.

source: ふいに悲しくなって―― 自分に腹が立って 気が付いたらこんな事を
target: Suddenly I just got so sad, so mad at myself, I just wanted it to end.

source: お互い腹を割って本音を明かす ことなんかできるのか...
target: Can you reveal each other's true intentions in a heart to heart...?

source: 腹を割って話そう
target: Perhaps a more visceral demonstration.

source: 腹を割って話しに来た
target: You... you came here to lay the cards on the table.

source: でも腹を抱えて笑ったよ
target: Yes, but it was hilarious. We laughed like drains.

source: その頃 俺様は... . はるか遠くの土地で 腹を抱えて大笑い
target: Meantime, Roland Turner is a thousand miles away, laughing his ass off.

source: 私は信用出来そうな者の腹を探る
target: I will sound out our most trusted officers.

source: 君が腹を痛めたジェイコブだ
target: The Jacob that you carried in your belly.

source: 猛ふぶきで ランタンを持ち 腹を立てていた
target: He was holding a lantern and he was in the blizzard, and I knew he was gonna be angry.

source: 腹を立てたのね
target: and took offense.

source: 気が動転したり 腹を立てた時だけで 何かで興奮状態になった時だ
target: Only when they're upset, pissed off, you know, emotional in some way.

source: 私腹を肥やすのに忙しいのさ
target: They're lining their pockets as fast as they can.

source: 自分の私腹を肥やす事しか 考えていないだろ
target: All you ever think about is fattening your own coffers.

source: あんたが私腹を肥やすことも...
target: And that pretty little nest you feathered for yourself.

source: 腹黒い奴はいた。
target: But there was someone black-hearted.

source: つまり　腹黒い毒島よりも １０倍　もっと腹黒い。
target: Meaning he's 10 times more black-hearted than the black-hearted Busujima.

source: ３人は綺麗でした でも心は腹黒く汚かった
target: All three were beautiful of face, but vile and black of heart.

source: 膝を折るから
target: Bend at your knees.

source: しかし傷の膿を出して もう一度包帯しなければなりません
target: - Okay. But I'll have to drain the wound and repack it.

source: 臆病風に吹かれたか！
target: If it's a fight you want, you've met your match!

source: 今日戦わなかった為に、敵は 我が臆病風に吹かれたと思うかもしれません
target: They may think we are discouraged because we're not fighting today.

source: 臆面もなく でたらめを言える奴だ
target: Someone who can bullshit their way out of anything.

source: 臆面もなく嘘を？
target: No, no, no. You lie to my fucking face?

source: ここに私達が堂々と 座ってられるなんて信じられる 臆面も無くよ?
target: Can you believe we're sitting out here in the open bold as brass?

source: いいや 自業自得だ
target: No, I earned what I got coming to me.

source: ウォルシュは 気の毒に見えるが 自業自得なんだ
target: And I know it seems a bit rough on Walshy, but don't forget he made this rod for his own back.

source: 自業自得よ
target: Paid the ultimate price.

source: ありがとう、ボス 至れり尽くせり
target: Level five's too damn easy, but, uh, we're tweaking it.

source: 勘で当てるのは至難の業だ
target: We have no idea which one.

source: （肇）よく舌が回るわ。
target: -I can never win.

source: 意図を感じますね （山里）舌が肥えすぎとる
target: -Yes, I sense an ulterior motive.

source: - レミ 舌を巻いて
target: - Remi, please roll your tongue.

source: 君がここの実権を握り舵を取るべきだ。
target: I have no doubt this D.O. would be well served with you at the helm.

source: 君のいる狭い小部屋から 大会社の運命の舵取りをするのは さぞ愉快だろうな
target: Must be quite a feeling-- steering the fate of a giant company from your tiny little cubicle.

source: 少し色を付けておいた
target: There is a little bit of extra there.

source: それは皆言うの 「お互いに色目を使う」？
target: Is that what people say, to "make eyes at each other"?

source: 色目を使ってくる男を あしらうのは簡単なのよ
target: See, it's really easy to get over with the testosterone at work, you know?

source: 最後の曲はアレックスに 花を持たせよう
target: All right, all right. We let Alex shine a little bit on that last one.

source: - 彼女に花を持たせて
target: - Let her have this.

source: 惨めな俺の人生に花を添えられる
target: In my brief, miserable life, there's the truth in it.

source: 君のライトセイバーが コレクションに花を添える
target: Your lightsabres will make a fine addition to my collection.

source: うるさくしすぎると 成長の芽を摘むかと
target: The thing is, constant warnings are maddening for anyone aspiring to be an overlord.

source: - 早く芽を摘まないといけない -　やめろ!
target: - I can put her out of her misery.

source: 彼等が力を持ち始める前に 芽を摘むのよ
target: It's time to eliminate them before they grow any stronger.

source: 若気の至りが バッチリ写ってます
target: The height of youthful folly

source: 最後の若気の至りだ
target: Making peace with past indiscretions.

source: 若気の至りを俺もしたぜ クライドはまだガキか？
target: Made the same mistake when I was a kid. So is Clyde still your dude?

source: ヘプタポットは複雑な文を 苦もなく２秒で書く
target: A heptopod can write a complex sentence in two seconds, effortlessly.

source: 彼らは漫然と生きる 苦もなくね
target: They drift through life effortlessly.

source: ［彼は対立や逆境を］ ［苦もなく処理できると言うけれども］
target: He says he deals with conflict and adversity easily, though.

source: 出てきて自由になったから 英気を養ってるんだな
target: So, Jake, you're out. You're free. You're rehabilitated.

source: これ、英気を養うよ
target: Here. It will restore your energy.

source: え ええ... 英気を養わなきゃ
target: - Uh, yeah, uh, sleep is good.

source: いいか小僧 人生は茨の道だ
target: You know what? Life's rough, kid.

source: そして、私 人生を目茶目茶にされて...
target: And me. We ruined her life.

source: 出入り不能にしている 茶番劇だな
target: No radio or satellite transmissions. Nothing but trust.

source: これは茶番だわ　茶番！
target: This is a travesty. A travesty!

source: - どうぞ 方の荷が下りる
target: I'm relieved.

source: 肩の荷が下りたんだ 次の数日は もっと凄い体験を
target: A weight has been lifted off his shoulders, and I can't wait for the next couple of days, because things are gonna get even crazier.

source: 一人でドロイドを片づける のは荷が重いからな
target: Very well. The burden is on me not to destroy all the droids until you arrive.

source: 年寄りには荷が重い
target: I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.

source: 荷が重いから渡したいのに
target: If you did, I'd be tempted to give it to you.

source: 積荷を下ろすんだ
target: Take everything off the wagon.

source: 積み荷を下ろして 中へ運ぶぞ
target: Okay, boys, let's get this haul unloaded and inside.

source: そうしなければいけないんだ 君も重荷を下ろした方がいい
target: And you alone, Mary, you alone may lighten this burden.

source: 落とし前をつけるつもりか?
target: Were you planning to clean up the place?

source: 蓋を開けてみると 攻撃が始まった時 ジョフは城壁に残ることに決めた
target: As it turned out, when the attack came, Joff insisted on remaining at the battlements.

source: 薄気味悪いほど
target: Well, they do bear an uncanny resemblance to the ears in the photograph.

source: まったく薄気味悪いんです
target: - I don't know, man, he's been acting really weird lately.

source: このバーガーを投げ入れて 薬が効くのを待つんだ
target: We'll toss these burgers over the gate, wait for the Demerol to kick in.

source: 薬が効いて来た とにかく急ごう!
target: Let's get that drip going and move out. Come on.

source: 薬が効くまで時間がかかる
target: We need longer for the sleeping potion to work.

source: ジメチル・スルホキシドと 混ざった場合 麻酔薬になる
target: Hey, if sophorine is mixed with dimethyl sulfoxide, it becomes an anesthetic.

source: 狂気は現代では 薬になり得る
target: Madness can be a medicine for the modern world.

source: ずっと彼の研究をしてるんだ 適切に希釈さえすればその毒は... とても有効な薬になる
target: I've been studying him, and I'm pretty sure that his venom could be quite useful if properly diluted.

source: これが藪から棒に聞こえるのは知ってるけど 僕は今売り出し中の身だ
target: I know this may sound farfetched, but I'm on the market now.

source: 藪から棒のオファーで
target: I can't believe you gave up your mop for this suit.

source: 藪をつついて蛇を出すってこと
target: Yeah. Let it rest.

source: そして遂に大海の藻屑となる。
target: And then you will be dropped into the ocean.

source: 虚仮にしている
target: He honeydicked the shit out of me. - Sucks.

source: 彼は虚勢を張ってると思うの
target: I think he's bluffing.

source: いや　トレメイン・アレクサンダーは 虚勢を張らない
target: No, Tremaine Alexander don't bluff.

source: 彼女は虚勢を張っている
target: She's bluffing.

source: だから 虫が好かなかった
target: I knew there was a reason I didn't like you.

source: 今日はずっと虫の居所が悪いな
target: All right something's been bugging you all day.

source: 今日は虫の居所が悪いのよ
target: Short fuse today I guess.

source: 虫の居所が悪かっただけ
target: Look, I had a bad moment. That's all.

source: 虫の息で捨てられていた
target: Abandoned, suffering, left to die.

source: -虫の知らせだけど
target: I'm telling you, Chad.

source: 虫の知らせの為に 私のキャリアを危険に晒せと?
target: And you expect me to risk my entire career on a hunch?

source: 貴方にも 何か 虫の知らせがあったはず
target: You already have a hunch something's wrong, Chad.

source: 虫酸が走る男ね
target: You disgust me.

source: 蚊帳の外に放り出すなよ
target: Promise me that you'll let me be there.

source: 組合は蚊帳の外さ
target: The association wasn't consulted.

source: 裁判官と主席弁護士が密談を 我々は蚊帳の外だ
target: Only the judge and the lead attorneys were privy, and our honorable D.A. is staying mum.

source: なんというか 心の蛇の生殺しだ
target: It's like, uh... blue balls in your heart.

source: 近々この街は蜂の巣をつついたような騒ぎになる
target: This town's about to buzz like a bee hive poked with a stick.

source: あなたは、融通が利かなく なってきています、フレイア
target: You've become quite literal, Freya.

source: 融通が利かないな
target: I thought you said he was cool.

source: 大統領は融通が利かない
target: The president's bulldog.

source: 彼を考えるたび 血が滾る
target: Every time I think about him, my blood boils.

source: - 血が引く思いだ
target: Oh, I think I'm bleeding somewhere.

source: （徳井）まあ 血が繋がってなければ いいんじゃないですか？ そんなものは
target: As long as you're not related.

source: " 血が通っている " と 思いたい
target: I like to think of it as a living system.

source: 「血が騒ぐとき、心が痛むとき」
target: ＃When the blood creeps, and the nerves prick,＃

source: 血が騒ぐよ
target: Gets blood pumping.

source: 血と汗の結晶よ
target: With our sacrifices and our blood.

source: 血の巡りが悪くなってるわ
target: - Yeah. The blood's having a hard time getting back to your heart.

source: そして「絞首刑の男」を見た時 君の顔から血の気が引いたね
target: And then when you saw the hanged man, the blood drained from your face.

source: 彼の目を見て 血の涙が
target: Now, if you look into his eyes, you can see him tearing blood.

source: 妙よね 血の涙なんてある？
target: I'd say bad day all around. I mean, can-- can someone actually cry blood?

source: -　そして彼らの妻達は 血の涙を流すでしょう"
target: "... and their wives will weep tears of blood."

source: 正確に言うと 血は水よりも濃くないだろ？
target: Hasn't exactly been thicker than water, has it?

source: 血は水よりも濃い
target: And blood is so much thicker than water.

source: 血も涙もない
target: A cold blooded setup.

source: ドラゴ・ブラッドビストは いかれた奴だ 血も涙もない
target: Because Drago Bludvist is a madman... without conscience or mercy.

source: あんたらは、スタークと血を分けた仲だろ？
target: Your people share blood with the Starks, don't they?

source: 血を分けた娘...
target: My flesh and blood.

source: これは私の血を分けた兄弟だ
target: This is my blood brother.

source: 前に輸血を受けたのは ５月１８日
target: My last platelet transfusion was May 18th.

source: ジークフリートを作ったのは 彼ら二人だ ヴェルズングの血を引いた最強の 男子を
target: Siegfried was born of their union, a youth of invincible strength.

source: ウィリアム・ターナーの血を引く 本当の子供はどこだ？
target: The child in whose veins flows the blood of William Turner? Where?

source: 一族の人がオオカミの血を 引いてるって知ってた？
target: Did you know Quileutes are supposedly descended from wolves?

source: 血眼になって探してる
target: This piece that's falling caused us bloody problems.

source: あの谷では袋の鼠じゃ セオデンは罠に踏み込んどる
target: There is no way out of that ravine. Théoden is walking into a trap.

source: 俺達は袋の鼠だ
target: We're trapped.

source: 袋の鼠だ
target: We're trapped.

source: 180人の選手達 20のステージ たった一人だけが イエロー・ジャージに袖を通す
target: One hundred and eighty riders, 20 stages, and only one gets to wear the Yellow Jersey.

source: あんたが裏で糸を引いてんの？
target: Are you the one who did this?

source: サーセイが裏で糸を引いている 知ってるだろ
target: Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it.

source: 裏で糸を引き 凶悪犯を創り上げる
target: You simply rule from behind the scenes.

source: 私は　裏に回った
target: I went around back.

source: 裏に回ろう
target: Let's go in the back.

source: 5分待ち 裏に回り 裏口を包囲
target: Wait five minutes. Go around and block the side entrance.

source: レンタカーだけでなく 彼は何とか人の裏をかいてる
target: He's got to get around somehow, just not by rental car.

source: 裏をかくことができる 前にもやった
target: I can outwit them, I've done it before.

source: 俺は銀行に当たって 裏を取る
target: I'll talk to the bank, make sure it wasn't a mistake.

source: 私もそう思いたくない 私が裏を取ります
target: Paul, I don't like it any more than you do, but I'll prove it.

source: 引っ張って来い 裏を取ろう
target: Bring her in. See what you get.

source: 裏を返せば もし侵攻を続ければ デュバクは間違いなくデバイスを悪用するでしょう
target: On the other hand, if you authorize the invasion, dubaku will undoubtedly engage the cip device.

source: 裏を返せば 失敗は許されないということだ
target: it means failure is not an option.

source: 君に2つの顔があるなら 裏目に出るぞ
target: The problem is when you're two people at the same time, one of them is bound to trip the other.

source: もし話して裏目に出たら？
target: What if Joe is right, and I tell them, and it backfires?

source: 互いに対してそれらをピットにあなたの策略 だから、資格でした 完全に裏目に出たようです。
target: Your ploy to pit them against each other seems to have backfired completely so that could qualify, yes.

source: ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの
target: She is just a bird flying.

source: 自由だから ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの ローラには裏表がなくて 誰に対しても同じ態度なの
target: She doesn't have an attitude repertoire, she doesn't have anything.

source: 汚い利益の２０００万ドルを 寄付したからと言って 襟を正した事にはならん
target: But even giving away $20 million of her company's ill gotten profits hasn't humbled Ms. Sherman much.

source: 襟を正さないと
target: Yeah, actually, this is really, really nice.

source: 警官は確かに要領がいいな まずい時に現れたな
target: You cops sure have a knack for showing up at the wrong time.

source: でも君は見所がある
target: They sent a nice kid, you'll be a good worker.

source: 見果てぬ夢と言っていた。
target: She said it was a lost cause.

source: 見果てぬ夢に見えると言っていた。
target: She said she could see it was a lost cause.

source: 見果てぬ夢という像は、サンタ・リタにある。
target: The patron saint of lost causes is saint rita.

source: 見栄を張るのは あまり好きじゃない
target: Ostentation is not something that I'm accustomed to.

source: あの方は美しいわ　あなたは見栄を 張らないようにすればいいの　虚栄心は罪よ
target: She is beautiful. You shouldn't be vain. Vanity is a sin.

source: 見栄を張ることは決して賢くないというね わかったかい？
target: This is a good lesson on why you never wanna lie about your ability to do things you clearly can't do, okay?

source: 私は、メール室で90分間 郵便の仕分けを待ってたのよ。 胸元に視線を浴びながら。 だから、私がキャットに これを渡します。
target: I spent the last 90 minutes in the mail room letting a glorified postal worker stare at my chest, so I could be the one to give this to Cat.

source: 彼はみんなの視線を浴びてる
target: Everyone's staring machine guns at him.

source: - 俺も息子も　視線を浴びるんだ
target: People would look at me and see him. That must have been very difficult for you.

source: 私は覚悟の上で参った 首を刎ねられる事も ドラゴンに焼かれる事も
target: And I came here knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive.

source: 彼らは覚悟の上だ！
target: They know that going in!

source: まあ　やるとしても 親身になって話を聞く人が必要だ
target: Well, if ever you need a friendly ear.

source: デイブは親身になってくれてる
target: I think Dave is really helping you.

source: 誰が親身になってくれる？
target: Who in your estimation is that sympathetic ear?

source: 受け入れるべきだよ。 言い得て妙じゃないか。
target: Well, you do have to admit, it is catchy.

source: 一緒にやれたら　言うことなしだ
target: And if you do it together, it's fantastic.

source: 言うことなしよ
target: It just couldn't have gone any better.

source: - 言うなれば...
target: No.

source: 言うなれば、 災い転じて、福となる
target: What a, what do you call it, a poetic turn of events.

source: 彼女は、言うなれば 気晴らしの叱責の提供者 好きな連中は 喜んで金を払う
target: She provides, shall we say, recreational scolding for those who enjoy that sort of thing and are prepared to pay for it.

source: 撃たれた銃弾が あなたを殺さないなら あなたが持ち込んだ この人生の嵐が殺さないなら 言わずもがな
target: If them bullets don't kill you, and this storm you somehow brought upon us don't kill you, goes without saying...

source: 言うは易く行うは難しだ
target: Easier said than done.

source: 言葉が過ぎるぞ
target: You're going too far!

source: 言葉が過ぎる
target: You do not even think something like that.

source: お言葉に甘えて
target: He convinced me.

source: お言葉に甘えます
target: If you insist.

source: お言葉に甘えたいけど悪いわよ
target: Oh, that's really sweet of you to offer, Rarity, but I can't let you do that.

source: 我々全員を子供と呼んだのです 言葉の綾です
target: I believe he's calling all of us children. Figure of speech.

source: 言葉の綾というやつなのね？
target: So, it was a figure of speech?

source: それは言葉の綾か？
target: Is that another figure of speech?

source: お父上も言葉を濁すことはなかった
target: Your father never minced words either.

source: お言葉を返すようだが 失せろ
target: All due respect, screw you.

source: 言葉を返せば 相手が消えても 反応する
target: That also means you notice when they're not there.

source: どう言葉を飾ろおと 奴の目的は この世界の破壊だ
target: And whether or not he admits it, his mission is global destruction.

source: おまえは冷ややかで 計算高いよ
target: You were cold and calculating.

source: 計算高い　恐いんだ
target: She's insanely jealous, she's irrational, and I'm frightened of her.

source: 計算高く 特に 犠牲を厭わないことが必要なのだと
target: calculating, and most of all... willing to sacrifice.

source: バービーの身の証を 立てられるのは私だけよ
target: I'm the only one who can exonerate Barbie.

source: それでお前を送って 詫びを入れてるわけか？
target: The man sends you to make his apologies?

source: 詰まる所 これは仕事さ
target: And that at the end of the day, it's a job as most jobs are.

source: 詰まる所 ジョンは 君をとても愛してるんだ この世の何よりも 君を失くして バラバラになっている
target: (SIGHS) Look, John loves you very much, more than anything in the world, and he's falling to fucking pieces without you.

source: 君は 話が分かりそうだ
target: Maybe you can talk some sense into these people's.

source: 話が合うよ
target: For you, I think they'd make an exception.

source: 話が合ってきましたね
target: Now you're speaking my language.

source: ここから数マイルの所でね 君たちと話が合うかもしれん
target: Yeah, he lives a few miles from here. He may be able to help you.

source: 思いがけなく会えた母親と 話が弾んでいたのだろう
target: I'm sure he's just... Spending a little quality time with his mother.

source: その通り 話が早いですね
target: Yes. We understand each other very well.

source: 話が早くていい
target: We appreciate your discretion, as always.

source: プリンスさんのおかげで 話が早い
target: Their presence has been decisive, Mister Prince, to encourage her.

source: 話が違います あのとき全ての...
target: That's not what you said. you said all...

source: 鳥と人間は話が違うよ
target: Recently dead bird? That's one thing. Dead person?

source: 話にならない 私は・・・
target: That's ridiculous. I can't be expected to...

source: あなたじゃ話にならない 腹ペコよ
target: You won't let me do anything and I'm so hungry.

source: 正気じゃない それは話にならない
target: You're out of your mind. No way. That's out of the question.

source: ...テレビを見ているようなら ここには世話にならない
target: If he's gonna be sitting around... we're taking him out of here.

source: よし　話に乗る
target: OK, I'll bite.

source: デネットは話に乗った
target: Dennett's on board.

source: もっと大きな声で そしたら話に乗ろう
target: A bit louder, my dear, and we can dance to it.

source: 伺って 話を詰めてきてください
target: Go talk to them and finalize the deal.

source: （仲谷）お２人には もう少し 話を詰めてから お伝えします
target: I'll let you know after we've talked more.

source: 実は今 ﾌｫｽﾀｰの極東ｴﾘｱﾏﾈｰｼﾞｬｰと 会って話を詰めてるんだが
target: I'm meeting with Foster's Far East Area Manager and working out some details.

source: - 調べがついたところじゃ 家族を失って　彼はひどく荒み
target: - Well,based on we could find, he was so devastated losing his family,

source: 奴が自分じゃ買えない物を全部買うために 君から金を借りたことは　２分で調べがついた
target: Well, it took us all of two minutes to find out he borrowed money from you, to buy all that stuff he really couldn't afford.

source: 調子がいいサインだよ ジェームスにとってはね
target: Good sign, actually. Means he's stoked.

source: 今夜は調子がいいな オレはちょっとトイレまで
target: You're having a good night. Mm-hmm. Okay, I am now gonna take the long walk to the little boy's room.

source: 僕は　君と一緒にいた方が　調子がいい
target: I am... better with you, Watson.

source: 席は１つだけだ 調子に乗るなよ マリア
target: You get one of those as captain, but don't push your luck, Maria.

source: 証拠はない 調子に乗るな
target: No proof, but you're not innocent yet! So let me defend you and stay quiet...

source: 2,3分は調子を合わせるんです でも... すぐに仕事に戻りました
target: And he'd play along for a few minutes, but... then he'd leave for work.

source: それで なんで調子を合わせる フィンチ?
target: So why'd you even play along, Finch?

source: 君と私は長い間友情をもってやってきた、 触れることなく、だが音のように、 いつも君に心の調子を合わせていると感じていた。
target: You and I went so long in our friendship without ever touching, yet I always felt attuned to you.

source: とにかく... 論より証拠だ
target: Anyway, the proof is in the pudding.

source: 諸刃の剣だよ
target: Perception's a tool that's pointed on both ends.

source: 張り込みでの水分補給は どっちみち諸刃の剣だ
target: Hydrating on a stakeout is a double-edged sword anyway.

source: 我々は諸手を挙げて賛成する
target: None of us had any problems with that.

source: 豹変したのだと　もっぱらの噂だ
target: People say he's changed.

source: 彼の目が 瞳が豹変して
target: His eyes were different.

source: 今、多くの軍は有るが その兵の 財布を握る者がいるので
target: Now we've got as many armies as there are men with gold in their purse.

source: - 上層部はあなたに責めを負わせたの？
target: They're letting you take the fall?

source: 爆破を仕掛けるのは　君だが 責めを負うのは　ＥＬＭだ
target: You get the blast, they get the blame.

source: 身代わりに　責めを負うこと
target: A scapegoat.

source: 君は責めを負う覚悟でいる 理由は 飛んで火に入る夏の虫の アダリンド親子を 逃がしたからで
target: You feel awful and take full responsibility for failing to stop Adalind and her child from slipping from your grasp and getting away, despite the fact that we had intercepted communications from Resistance agents, which gave you sufficient time to disrupt their plans.

source: 汚れ役を買って出なきゃ いけなかったりもすると思うの
target: I think it means you might have to take on the dirty job at times.

source: 会社が買って出た？
target: Harbinger sponsored that?

source: 金のためなら　患者を どんな危険な目に遭わせようと→ オペを買って出る。
target: She volunteers to take on any operation for money, no matter how great the risk to the patient.

source: 顔が赤くなるわ・・・
target: You got me blushing' 'til I...

source: 赤子の手をねじるようなもの
target: It's child play.

source: 赤子の手を捻るが如く 神がルシファーを倒したように 皆あなたに復讐するのよ
target: They will seek a vengeance on you that will make God striking down Lucifer seem like child's play.

source: 今までにない 趣向を凝らしている
target: It is a spectacle unlike most have ever witnessed.

source: 僕は趣向を凝らしてるんだ。
target: I'm trying different things.

source: 相対性理論と量子論の 融合には不足があった
target: The equation couldn't reconcile relativity with quantum mechanics. You need more. More?

source: リードのお嬢様は堅苦しくて冗談が通じない 地に足が付いてるのかしら
target: Lady Reed here's got a stick so far up her ass, it's a wonder her feet touch the ground.

source: あなたは足が付いている
target: They might be able to trace the reset signal back to you.

source: だが 君から俺達に足が付くんじゃ？
target: Hang on. Wouldn't it be awful if it was traceable back to us?

source: ? ) 足が出て当然だ
target: No wonder he has issues.

source: 足が出ない
target: But my feet wouldn't move.

source: - 足が早いのは誰だ？
target: Whoever's the fastest runner. - Who is that? - I am.

source: ケスラーみたいな輩は 逃げ足が早いんだ
target: The quieter we are, the better chance we have in getting him.

source: 雷に撃たれて 足が早くなった青年よ
target: Struck by lighting? Was in a coma for nine months? Woke up being able to run faster than the speed of sound?

source: 足が速い以外に、何か 特技があるといいけど。
target: I hope you're bringing more to the table than just quick reflexes.

source: 逃げ足が速い！ ！ ？
target: They're getting away!

source: 我々にはある言い伝えがあった 足が速く．．． 雪のように白い．．．
target: There's a prophecy that tells of a creature, swift of foot white as snow.

source: 海岸は　完全に開放され 世界でも有数の美しい景色が楽しめます この痛ましい事件ひとつのために 人々の足が遠のかないことを願っています
target: The beaches are fully opened, it's a beautiful part of the world and... we hope people aren't put off coming by this... tragic, yet isolated event.

source: あぁ... 足が重いわ...
target: Fuck, my feet are killing me.

source: それぞれに足を入れろ　エリック
target: One for each leg, Eric.

source: 彼が足を入れた場所に 薬の痕跡が残ってたから
target: There are still tiny traces of it in the trainers from where he put the cream on his feet.

source: 封筒には ウサギの足を入れた
target: So I put my rabbit's foot in that package.

source: 奴が絨毯に足を取られて
target: His foot got caught in the shag throw.

source: 僕の足を引っ張りに 席のあるうちに行かなきゃ!
target: Daniel brought in Chad to backstab me-- oh, I mean help me-- and I gotta get to work before he helps me out of a job.

source: 足を引っ張るな
target: To me you're dead weight.

source: ゲームがこの子の 足を引っ張ってるね
target: Because of this gaming, it pulled him right down.

source: 私は書斎から出てきたことはないし 彼女も階段で足を止めたことなどない
target: I never left my study. Never stopped her on the stairs.

source: バギンズ殿 足を止めるんじゃない
target: Master Baggins... I suggest you keep up.

source: 足を止めろ
target: You got to stop tapping.

source: 足を洗うんだ 友達は殺された
target: Don't do the job.

source: 俺は汚いビジネスから 足を洗うよ
target: I'm gonna wash my hands of our dirty little business.

source: １週間前は 足を洗うと言ってただろ
target: A week ago you talked like you were all ready to hang it up.

source: 多くの吸血鬼が自分の領土に足を踏み入れたように 多くのクイートも戻ってきた
target: As more vampires set foot in their territory, more Quileutes turned.

source: このアントンは うんざりする男だ 地獄の王国に足を踏み入れた
target: This Anton... he may have been a skeevy bloke, but he had a toe in the nether realm, all right.

source: 可愛い天才君が 足を踏み入れたんだろ 役員会の連中は 歓迎したか？
target: Did you walk in there, do your adorable boy genius thing, and the board of directors was less than impressed?

source: 「ヴィン、こんなはした金のために、 オレにここまで足を運ばせないでくれ」
target: Vin, don't make me have to come down here again for this.

source: ブログでフラッシュの 活躍を読んでー 今まで事件現場に足を運んだ
target: I read your friend Iris' blog post on The Flash, and I visited all the crime scenes you fought at.

source: 彼にこれ以上足元を見ることを許さず 自分の好意を証明した
target: You demonstrated your goodwill without allowing him to take further advantage.

source: 足元を見て歩いて
target: Woman: How 'bout, this time, you watch where you're going?

source: 足元を見な
target: Thanks for dropping by.

source: ロビーが足場を固め バッターボックスに入ります
target: - That's the name. Robby digs in and we're under way.

source: この国はその足場を 失う危険があった
target: This country has always been in danger of losing its footing.

source: 気を付けて 馬が足場を失う
target: Careful. Your horse could have lost its footing.

source: 私の隊を送ったが ドイツ軍に足止めを食らっている
target: Jerry took them out.

source: うちらがアウター・リムで足止めを食らった
target: We have been stranded out here without any help at all.

source: 船が故障して 直るまで 足止めを食らってるのよ
target: Our ship was damaged, and we're stranded here until we can repair it.

source: 謙譲と美徳を足蹴にしているのだ
target: Violating and humiliating Charity and Virtue.

source: 6ドルじゃ路頭に迷う
target: Six dollars an hour puts my family on the street.

source: 俺がいなきゃ姉一家は路頭に迷ってた ―そうなの？
target: If I wasn't there, they'd be on the street.

source: 我々 メガバンクは 絶対に つぶれてはいけないんだ それだけは死守せねばならない もし つぶれでもしたら 何百万人 何千万人が 路頭に迷うか 分かってますか？
target: Our mega-bank cannot collapse. do you know how many millions of people will be out in the cold? some sacrifice is inevitable.

source: 誰かがすでに盗んでた たぶん 誰かが 捕まえるのに躍起になってる
target: Someone had already jacked it, perhaps someone who's out to get him.

source: 小さな町で行方不明の女の子 皆が躍起になって探す
target: Missing girl in a small town would throw up all kinds of red flags.

source: あんたの部下が　この電話を辿ろうと 躍起になってるなら 落ち着くように言ってくれ
target: If your men are scrambling to trace this call, you can tell them to relax.

source: 俺は不死身になり 強大な力を得た
target: Now I'm immortal and supercharged!

source: 身に余るご紹介を　どうも
target: My thanks, Mr. McCabe, you are too kind.

source: 身に余る光栄です 違う。
target: We don't deserve this honor.

source: 身も蓋もないが 仕方が無い
target: There's no great way to say this, so I'll just say it.

source: "穏やかな夜に 身を任せるな"
target: Do not go gentle into that good night

source: 気高い貴方に恥知らずに身を任せた
target: Flee from the corpse of one who unworthily gave herself to a man of honour

source: 見知らぬ者は二月初めに来た... ある冬の日... 身を切るような風と 雪が降る中
target: "The stranger came early in February... one wintry day... through a biting wind and a driving snow.

source: （吉森） 岩崎先生が身を削って 作りあげたものは お前たちそのものだ ！
target: The thing that Iwazaki created at his own expense... Is YOU people!

source: 〈身を削ってる〉
target: [Seth] ...for better or worse.

source: ついにジェイソンも 身を固めるか？
target: So is this it? She the one gonna take jason stackhouse Off the market for good?

source: 長男がついに身を固めた
target: My elder son is finally taken!

source: どこに身を寄せた
target: Where'd you go? Who took you in?

source: 各地から逃れたドゥネダインが- タウアディルに身を寄せた
target: Taurdal filled as many of the Dúnedain fled their homes and sought safety in numbers.

source: 私に身を寄せなければ 安全じゃない
target: And now I know my son is not safe unless he's by my side.

source: 人というのは　自分が許してしまえば ここまで深く 身を沈めてしまうのだと 思い出させるために
target: It reminds me of the depths to which a man can sink if he lets himself.

source: これは議論じゃあない まるでグリルで身を焼かれるようだ
target: No, this isn't a discussion, it's a grilling.

source: お前自身を焼き尽くすのだ
target: It's gonna burn you out.

source: 大変だな・・ 男社会で身を立てて行くのは
target: Amazing... what one has to do to get ahead in a man's world.

source: しかし　あんたが消えた後も 俺は舞台にいて 演劇で身を立てて 情熱を燃やし 複雑な感情と闘う それが演劇ってもんだ
target: But long after you're gone, I'll be on that stage... earning my living, baring my soul, wrestling with complex emotions, 'cause that's what we do.

source: 家族のために 身を粉にしてる
target: You're slaving away so you can give us a good life.

source: どこで犯罪者に 身を落としたのかな
target: I mean, what do you think it is that makes them who they are?

source: もう依頼人でも無い人のために あなたが身銭を切る 義務も無いのよ
target: Nor are you obligated to spend your savings on behalf of someone who's no longer your client.

source: どのように奇妙な 私はルシファーが軌道に乗ることができない
target: How strange I can't get Calcifer going

source: ラグランジュポイントを越えて軌道に乗るよ、 無事に、ハーシェル(火星のクレーター)へ。
target: The trajectory will take it beyond the Lagrange point so that it doesn't hit Herschel.

source: 一連のすべてが軌道に乗ってるか... 評価したいだけだ
target: I am merely trying to assess just how close this train is hugging the tracks.

source: おい 軽口を叩くな
target: Hey, Earl, have some fucking respect, okay?

source: アーノルドと同じ轍を踏むな
target: You mustn't make Arnold's mistake.

source: 導かれる答えは一つ... だが 昨夜と同じ轍を踏まないように より多くの情報を収集した― ゆえに 遅れたわけだ
target: The clues point in one direction, but to avoid repeating last night's debacle I was obliged to collect more sufficient data, hence my tardiness.

source: まるで -- 辻褄が合わない
target: It looks like-- It doesn't add up.

source: 辻褄が合わないわ
target: And it makes no sense.

source: "そうか" じゃ無い 辻褄が合わない
target: No, no, not okay, it doesn't make sense.

source: もしそうなら、どのように辻褄を合わせますか あなたの医師兼トレーナーが ドーピングに関わっていることについては？
target: And if so, how do you reconcile that with your doctor/trainer being so associated with doping?

source: 返す言葉がないね
target: Well, what can I say to that?

source: そう言われたら 返す言葉がないわ そういうことさ
target: - Then there's nothing I can say.

source: 迷える羊の捜索は あんたに任せるよ
target: I'll leave you to track down your lost sheep.

source: 迷宮入り事件を調べるように言え
target: Tell him to go over cold cases.

source: 無線を切って　その迷宮入りの件の調査を 俺のとこに送ってくれ
target: Sign off on the cold cases, and have them sent to me. Right.

source: 全部迷宮入り事件だ
target: Cold cases.

source: つまり 悲しみに打ちひしがれる家族に 追い討ちを掛ける訳だ
target: So he returns to feed off the grief he's caused by blinding his victims.

source: 逃がした魚は大きいですよ
target: You don't know what you're missing.

source: あっ そうか　悪かった 逃がした魚は大きいぞ
target: Oh. Yeah, okay, yeah. Too bad.

source: 逃がした魚は大きいわ
target: The one that got away.

source: きっと　逃げるが勝ちと 考えたんだろう
target: Guess he figured discretion's the better part of valor.

source: 私は逃げも隠れもしない
target: I don't believe in the hidden ball trick.

source: 俺は逃げも隠れもしない
target: I won't run and hide, you understand?

source: 逃げも隠れもしない
target: I'm right here.

source: 私が笑いかけても 逃げ腰になるの
target: He starts backing away if I even smile at him.

source: 逃げ腰にならなくてもいいよ ワイリーがセキュリティー面は
target: Don't be defeatist.

source: いざ愛を告白されると 逃げ腰になる
target: I mean, why is it that we all need to be loved but then when somebody finally says, "I love you," people just run scared.

source: ゴルゴ13じゃねえんだから 逆立ちしても お前には無理だ
target: Riggs, there ain't but three shooters in the whole damn world who can make that shot, and you ain't one of 'em!

source: 途方に暮れてる
target: clueless on the floor.

source: 俺は 見たくない お前が イラつき 途方に暮れる姿を...
target: I don't wanna see you wake up one day all old and pissed off realising you're lost.

source: 息子のことで途方に 暮れてるシングル・マザーだった 彼は何度も逃げて 学校から追放され内向的になっていた
target: A single mother at her wits' end about her son, a thieving introvert expelled from school because he kept running away,

source: 明るい見通しを持てないというのなら 心臓を調べてもらったほうがいいでしょう。 なぜなら、途方もない見事な素晴らしい猛然と突き進む、 この世界の人々の集団が、何とかしようと 取り組んでいるのですから。
target: because there is an extraordinary, beautiful, gorgeus, fierce group of people in this world, who are taking this on.

source: やっぱり全世界一 セクシーなのは... 途方もない銃を 持つ美女だな
target: There is nothing more sexy in the whole world than a beautiful woman with an incredible gun.

source: -　サットンは途方もない悪だった
target: - Sutton was a much greater evil. - Was?

source: これは途轍もない大きさです ここ、カリフォルニアで 東海岸でも感じられるでしょう
target: It will be so big that even though it's happening here in California you will feel it on the East Coast.

source: ミュージカルへの投資には危険が伴う だけどヒットすれば 見返りは途轍もなく大きい
target: Investing in a musical can be risky, but when a show hits, there's literally no limit to the return.

source: ジョージ・ラズレ エイリアン ハンター 通りがいいのは UFO研究家です
target: George Lazure, alien hunter. Or if you prefer, ufologist.

source: 遅かれ早かれ彼らは 正面を向くだろう
target: Oh, they'll swing around to the front sooner or later.

source: 遅かれ早かれ したくない事でも やることになるわ
target: You know, sooner or later, you're gonna have to do something for them you don't want to.

source: 私たちはビルに居て静かにできるわ でも　遅かれ早かれ私たちは彼らを 引っ張りだすつもりよ
target: We can stay close to the buildings and keep quiet, but sooner or later, we're gonna be drawing 'em.

source: 運が向いてきたようね
target: - You ready for me to make your day?

source: 俺を欲しがってる 運が向いてきたぜ！
target: They want me. We're going to the big time!

source: - 続けてれば運が向くかも
target: - Stay on it. We might get lucky.

source: 運を天に任せるなんて したくないの...
target: I DON'T LIKE TO LEAVE MUCH TO CHANCE...

source: 隠し口座 見つけたとしても 全部 国税に持ってかれんで やるだけのことは やりました こうなったら後は 運を天に任せるしかありません
target: the Taxation Bureau's gonna snatch everything away. we'll have to leave the rest to fate.

source: 別動隊のおかげで道が開いた
target: Weaver's team has bought us a window. The road to the power plant's wide open. We're going in.

source: [遠くへの道が　開かれる]
target: Can possibly know how far they can go. "

source: 遺書を捜し出す そこから道が開けるでしょう
target: I'm gonna try to find the will, and then we'll take it from there.

source: 音を聞いて 本を読めば 僕らの道が開ける
target: Sort some sounds and read the books, and we'll be on our way.

source: あそこまで道を付けるのに ２人で必要だ
target: - I need two bodies to help clear a route over there.

source: 還暦ですか
target: -Otherwise... -Retired?

source: 郷に入っては郷に従えだ
target: I prefer to work with people who know the area.

source: 『郷に入っては郷に従え』よ！
target: do as the Romans do!

source: 人のニーズに 重きを置いてます 鎮痛薬 Pain relief.
target: What we like to focus on is what people really need, pain relief.

source: あなたが映画に重きを置くのが 気掛かりで・・・
target: I am a little concerned at the importance you're placing on movies.

source: ヤツとキャリーが安全な場所で うまくやる可能性より そっちの方に重きを置いた方が いいと思う
target: I guess I'd weigh that against the likelihood of him and Carrie making it to the safe house at all.

source: 大金が得られる
target: Access billions.

source: もし、こんな事をしてお金が 得られると思ってるんだったら とんでもない考え違いだわ
target: If you think you'll take this money, terribly wrong.

source: 金に糸目を付けず、 修理中だ... ...メジャー並みの 設備になるぜ... ...何せ、ヤンキースとの 特別試合だからな
target: I'm gonna spare no expense in fixing it up and making it look like a big-league stadium because we're gonna play an exhibition game with the Yankees.

source: 彼はあなたがお金のある ロックスターだと知っていた お金のなる木だと
target: He knew you were a rock star with money and endless resources.

source: ところで 金の成る木は育つかも知れないが まず見つけるのが難しいのでは？
target: Yeah, well money might grow on trees where you're from but it's a little harder to come by here.

source: ハッチは金のなる木でした
target: Hutch was the golden goose. He brought in hundreds

source: 金の切れ目が縁の切れ目だ
target: You run out of money, you run out of friends.

source: もしも... 金回りがいいことを 怪しまれたら?
target: What if... they suspect you using money like crazy?

source: だからこう言う資格があると思う そのイヴとは　金輪際　関わっちゃいけない
target: So I'm qualified when I say, you must cut this Eve out of your life entirely.

source: あなたは このつまらぬ一座を 解散し 金輪際　魔女を
target: You disband this little merry troupe of assholes, vowing never to harm another witch from now until the end of time.

source: 金輪際、あの子はいない。
target: She most certainly is not.

source: 彼らは金魚の糞も同然で 彼女の"視た"解釈を そのまま受け止めるのよ
target: They're totally open to interpretation.

source: 誰が相手か 釘を刺しただけだ
target: I'm just saying they got to know that they're working for you.

source: しかもそれが具体化する事のないよう 念入りに釘を刺しておいた
target: Furthermore, I was given every assurance it never passed the planning stage.

source: 鉄のカーテンの向こう側と 同じような
target: THINKS SOMEONE DRESS BEHIND THE IRON CURTAIN.

source: 鉄のカーテンの 内部を受け持つ 衛星４号と呼ばれる セクションにいた
target: He was also a planner in the section called Satellites 4, which operates behind the Iron Curtain.

source: あなたが暗殺者へ鉄槌を下すのを手伝えば エリアの正義を勝ち取ることを手伝う
target: You help me serve justice to the king's assassins and I will help you serve justice to Elia's.

source: 僕は　悪魔のようなサイコパスに 正義の鉄槌を下したんだ
target: I gave an evil psychopath justice.

source: スジーマンスキー刑事は 事件の鍵を握ってる
target: Detective Szymanski is key to your case.

source: 誰にしろその人が― この試験の鍵を 握ってるのね 名乗り出てよ
target: Okay, whoever is holding out could be the key to cracking this exam, so you better speak up now.

source: （テレビの音声） では続いて次のニュースです ルモンド社 贈収賄事件を 捜査中の東京地方検察庁特捜部は 一連の事件の鍵を 握っているとみられる―
target: The Tokyo District Attorney's office special task force, investigating the Lumondo Corp. bribery has announced that they have questioned Sakichi Konuma president of Konuma Industries as a key witness

source: 長い目で見れば全然
target: I mean, in the long run, at all; at all.

source: 長い目で見れば 傷つけたくない　だから -
target: I don't want to hurt you in the long run, so--

source: 誓って　長い目で見れば 君はこのことで僕に感謝するよ
target: I swear, in the long run, you're gonna thank me for this.

source: 新聞売店に君の写真が出て以来... 入隊の長蛇の列ができている。
target: The enlistment lines have been around the block since your picture hit the newsstands.

source: この"獣"には門外漢ゆえ
target: - I don't know what beast this is!

source: ビジターに門戸を開くのは 良い事だな
target: Establishing ties with the Visitors is a good thing, Jack.

source: だからそう言うビジネスをやる予定なんだ 門戸を開いてね
target: I'm gonna form this business and I want everybody to get a shot.

source: 興奮は冷めやりません 想像を超えた新しい世界へ 門戸を開くのです
target: Nothing can take away from the excitement... as we open our doors to a nation from beyond our imagination.

source: 店は閑古鳥が鳴いてる 連中はビルをすぐ手放すさ
target: It's like a ghost ship around here. They're gonna be begging to sell this place within a month.

source: 学校には 閑古鳥が鳴いています 子供達を家庭に 保護するための 登校拒否が 急増しているからです
target: Schools stand like mausoleums, their attendance drastically declined, as parents keep their children safely home.

source: 閑古鳥が鳴いていた
target: A pretty rough drought this past year.

source: 今この瞬間がいいんだ
target: Best to take the moment present

source: バリでの2週間がいい！
target: I want two weeks in Bali!

source: 間が悪かったか？
target: This a bad time?

source: お前の墓石には、 こう刻め、 "いつも場違いで、間が悪い"
target: On your tombstone it should read, "Always in the wrong place at the wrong time."

source: 間が悪すぎる " Ｃ " に踊らされてるみたいだ
target: Not great timing for us, we're rather playing into C's hands.

source: ここの人間が 悪いと思ってると思うか？ 祖父母や曽祖父母が 手を汚したおかげだ
target: Their grandparents and their great grandparents, they're the ones who got their hands dirty.

source: 「終身刑になるのが関の山だ」
target: You get a life sentence for it.

source: - オレみたいな男は... せいぜい成功者の下で 働くのが関の山なんだ 皆から愛されている 分かるだろ
target: - Guys like me... work their whole lives to be in something that's successful, that people like.

source: 私を撃って真実を闇に葬るのか
target: Or you can shoot me and never know.

source: 君とウォルデンは隠蔽工作を 無人爆撃の件を闇に葬った
target: Only that you and Walden... went to great lengths once before to cover up the drone strike.

source: ２年前― この船の真実が 闇に葬られた
target: Well, two years ago, the elephant in the room was this scow.

source: 博物館じゃ、"阿吽の呼吸"だった
target: You and I had some pretty good teamwork back there at the... Whaling Museum.

source: 可能な限りを尽くす
target: Whatever you can.

source: 持てる力の限りを尽くす
target: I'll do everything in my power to keep Nick away from my family.

source: 慈悲深き主よ 力の限りを尽くし アギーのテレビ受信を 改善したまえ
target: Dear merciful Lord, please do what you can to get a better reception for Aggy's TV.

source: 彼が誰が陰で糸を引いたか 知ってるか確認してくれ
target: Make sure he knows who pulled the strings.

source: 誰かが陰で糸を引いてるなら
target: If someone's pulling their strings,

source: 陰口を叩く者共はお前のおかげで助かった
target: You defend these men who insult you behind your back.

source: 俺の陰口を叩いてくれてありがとう
target: Thanks for talking about me behind my back.

source: まるで紙上演習みたいに 額のシンボルまで 隅から隅まで酷似してる
target: It was like a-a dry run on paper, all the way down to the weird symbol that we found on the victim's forehead.

source: 隅から隅まで調べたが 何も・・・
target: Nothing. Our guys went over it from the last bit and pixel.

source: 隅から隅まで調べるの
target: Leave no stone unturned, Dr. Hodgins.

source: クックは鉱工業を隠れ蓑にして アジアをコントロールしてた
target: Cook used his mining empire as a cover to control the Asian franchise.

source: 彼らを強くする秘訣― 「雨降って地固まる」
target: In order to make our agents stronger, we have to break them down to build them back up again.

source: だけど雲泥の差!
target: But what a difference.

source: 雲行きが怪しい
target: That storm on the horizon that I mentioned,

source: 雲行きが怪しくなると 決まって入院するんだ
target: When the going gets rough he always checks into the hospital

source: 雲行きが怪しいな
target: Okay, this is getting a little weird.

source: 雲行きが怪しいと 口にしたから-
target: That storm on the horizon that I mentioned--

source: ついてると思ってるか青二才？
target: the boy's pheromone level suggests he wants to mate with the female.

source: あなたが青写真を描いたとき、我々はかろうじて理解できる年齢でした。
target: We were barely old enough to drink when you sketched the blueprint.

source: 校長先生が青くなってる
target: I wonder why the principal looks so pale.

source: 面が割れたのは　わたし
target: Nobody saw your face and I shot that dumb prick.

source: 面が割れたんだ
target: You've been compromised.

source: お前の面が割れてる
target: Oh, with your face being all over the news,

source: 小物なら一発だ 面の皮が 厚くなければね
target: It shouldn't damage the bastard unless its skin is thinner than ours.

source: 後ろに戻って、クローンの 面倒を見て
target: Just get in the back and take care of the clones.

source: 泊まりに来て欲しい時は　言ってね シャーリーンの面倒をみるわ
target: If you need me to stay over,keep you company... I can babysit charlaine.

source: -　子供の面倒を見るべきです
target: - Is doing what children do best.

source: お前の面倒をみるのは俺の仕事だ だから望む事に腹を立ててる
target: It's my job to get you through it. So you can be pissed off all you want.

source: 閣下が面目を失われることは避けられません フリンク氏は必ずや逮捕され その時には閣下もお困りになることでしょう
target: I can do nothing about the loss of face you will suffer in connection with this as and when Mr. Frink is inevitably apprehended.

source: 何度もロブ・スタークに面目を潰されることは時間を消費する
target: Being repeatedly humiliated by Robb Stark is time-consuming.

source: これで音を上げては 現場では働けないぞ
target: But if you think this is pressure, wait until you're out in the field.

source: 音を上げさせようとした
target: Hoping he'd crack up, and just fuck off.

source: 音沙汰が無くなる この世から居なくなったみたいに
target: He goes silent like he fell off the face of the earth.

source: それにより音沙汰がなくなる
target: There's no word for this.

source: あまりにも長い間、音沙汰が無いので、心配していた。
target: We were worried when we didn't hear from you for so long.

source: 君達のボスとして 乾杯の音頭を取ろう
target: It falls upon me as your beloved boss to propose a toast.

source: 頭が上がらないようだな
target: Makes you wonder what's going on in that little head of hers.

source: 永遠に頭が上がらないわね
target: I am indebted to you forever.

source: 俺は一生、 彼に頭が上がらないな
target: I expect I'll be in his debt for the rest of my life.

source: もし彼女がそれほど冷血でないのなら 頭が下がる思いよ
target: If she weren't so bloodless, you'd really have to take your hat off to her.

source: そうだろうな、お前の戦略計画の 広範な経験には頭が下がるよ
target: Of course. We bow to your vast experience in strategic planning.

source: いいかい・・・ 君は頭が切れる
target: Look... you're a bright guy.

source: このグループは頭が切れる 彼らの行動を彼女は理解できない
target: These groups are clever, blinding her to their actions.

source: 鎮痛薬を買いに出ていたんだ 頭が割れるようだった
target: I went out for some painkillers, my head was about to explode.

source: 彼はただ、ええと、頭が固い。
target: He's just, uh, not enlightened.

source: なぜお前はそう頭が固いんだ
target: Must you always be so small-minded?

source: いかれて頭が固くなってるあの男を！ ？
target: A man whose idea of a romantic nightspot and an impenetrable fortress are the same thing.

source: 頭が痛くなりそうだよ
target: See, I'm going to get stuck now with that song.

source: おととい資料もらってな クラス全員の名前と写真 ぜんぶ頭に入れたー
target: I got the teaching material 2 days ago. I have memorized all students' names and photos.

source: ベニーの帽子を壊して 頭に来て攻撃しようとしてたら 彼が粉々になっちゃって 僕のせいじゃないけど 追われる事になって・・・
target: I was so livid that I attacked Tybalt and he ended up getting smashed, which wasn't my fault, and I was chased out.

source: 頭に来る 見てもらえるか？
target: Give it a rap, will ya? See if you could get it going for me.

source: ぶん殴ってやりたいよ 頭に来た
target: I'm going to blow this shit right off the mountain right now.

source: 私は頭に血が上り 車に飛び乗った
target: So I'm pissed. And the clock is ticking, so I jump in my truck.

source: 彼女が望んだから あの娘は頭に血が上ってて
target: 'Cause she wanted to. She lashes out.

source: ロデリック なぜ修道士は 頭を剃るのだろう あんな風に？
target: Roderick why do you think them monks shave their heads like that?

source: 頭を剃るかもしれないって
target: He said they might have to shave my head.

source: よし　頭を剃るアイディアに ついて語ろう
target: Now, let's talk about that shaved head idea.

source: - 頭を下げて
target: - Bow your head.

source: 頭を下げてろ 武器を手に入れたらすぐに マウンテンに向かうぞ
target: As soon as we have the weapons, we'll make straight for the mountain

source: ゆっくり頭を下ろして
target: I want you to lay down nice and gently. Nice and gently.

source: 頭を下ろして、大丈夫？
target: Head on down, okay?

source: ただ頭を丸めただけだろ?
target: The hell did you shave your head for, fool!

source: 頭を冷やしたほうがいいと 思うので。
target: I think it's better (when he's) cooled off. A certain somebody.

source: 頭を切り換えられなかったんだ
target: It's me, I couldn't get out of my head.

source: 頭を切り替えましょう
target: You need to disconnect, Boss.

source: 先ず あなた方が 頭を切り替え "仕分け達人"になるの
target: So, first we will be installing and training you on a system that we're calling, "The Wizard."

source: 頭を切り替えようとしても
target: I keep turning things around in my mind.

source: 君は 王族の人間関係に― 頭を 悩ますべきではない
target: But you shouldn't bother your pretty little head about all this royal intrigue.

source: 考えても見ろ どこに 頭を抱える必要がある？
target: Think about it. When I'm studying for the bar and you're writing your thesis this is the shit we're gonna think about.

source: 命を奪うことに ...夢中にっていた、だが僕は、... 命を生み出すという事で頭を抱えて悩んでいる。
target: I've been so preoccupied with taking a life, I'm, uh... having trouble wrapping my head around making one.

source: 頭を振って？
target: Just nod your head? Baby?

source: 頭を振るだけでも？
target: Can you just nod your head, baby?

source: - 頭を振るな
target: Don't turn your head!

source: ２ポンドでも 頭を痛めてるのに
target: 4 pounds, as if 2 pounds wasn't bad enough.

source: 頭を痛めるとしたら 長引いてる あなたの捜査よ
target: Yours,however,could take a turn for the worse if you don't wrap up this investigation.

source: 今　この国が最も 頭を痛めてる問題は？
target: What bugs you the most about this country?

source: スズメバチの巣に 頭を突っ込んだ
target: Stoved his head in a hornets nest

source: だが その年寄りだけが 頼みの綱なんだろう
target: This old man's all you've got. You know that and I know that.

source: 魔法使いの頼みの綱だ
target: It's a wizard's bread and butter, really.

source: だといい　頼みの綱だ
target: I hope so. My best chance of getting back home.

source: 三十六国に顔が利くだろう？
target: Aren't you close to the thirty-six nations?

source: 数学クラブにも新聞部にも 顔が利く　ハッカーのメンバーだし
target: I also have my Math Club Card, Hacker Membership, Journalist Pass,

source: VCに顔が利く
target: - He's got connections to VCs.

source: だが奴は顔が売れすぎてる
target: There's no way! The guy's too high profile.

source: 顔が広いから デルグロスに頼まれた
target: Delgros knew I had their ear, so he offered me money to push things through.

source: 中東では顔が広い
target: I ran many sorts of parts to all sorts of places in the Middle East.

source: 飲み屋からボストンまで顔が広い人がいる
target: He's got the ear of every captain from Bar Harbor to Boston.

source: 顔が 揃っていません
target: Not everyone's here yet. What about Fornay?

source: なぜ顔が潰れてる？
target: Why do you think he smashed in the face?

source: 私の顔が潰れるまでは 私を利用して
target: Yeah, so when this blows up in my face, you can fire my ass.

source: - 顔に出てるぞ
target: - It's starting to show.

source: 今 君は生きているが 内なる汚れは 顔に出ている
target: Now in order for you to stay alive we have to match your face with the ugliness of your soul.

source: 動揺が顔に出る、ですね
target: They make mistakes. Nice.

source: ♪顔に書いてあるよ♪
target: ♪ Sittin' right on your face ♪

source: 顔に書いてある
target: I can see that they haven't.

source: 顔に書いてあるだけさ
target: Just what's written on your face.

source: 君たちは約束を破って 私の顔に泥を塗った
target: - You went back on your word, And then you rubbed my face in it.

source: ソンレンも　男の子を産んだら 誰かの顔に　泥を塗ってしまうわね
target: If fourth sister has a son someone will be very unhappy.

source: 誰かが手下のネイサンの 顔に泥を塗った！
target: Someone chases my boy Nate out of the tick tock and puts one in his face!

source: 顔を作っているように 見えたのは以外だった。
target: I didn't know your face muscles could make that look.

source: 僕が閲覧したポルノサイト情報から エヴァの顔を作った？
target: Did you design Ava's face based on my pornography profile?

source: パンザーの事件のことで FBIが　至る所に顔を出してくる
target: FBI's all over us about this, Panzer case.

source: - その内 顔を出すさ
target: - It'll show up.

source: クインシー辺りにゃ 顔を出すなよ
target: And you better never show your face around Quincy, you hear me? Okay, come on. Ever!

source: んー、いや、直接顔を合わせた方がいい、 そう思うんだ。
target: Mm, no, in person's better, I think.

source: 親族が顔を合わせる機会は 何度もあったが― 殺したいとは思っても 殺したことはなかった
target: Look, buddy, I'm trying to be objective here, but we've had countless family functions before, and even though we wanted to kill one another, we never did.

source: どうやって お互い顔を合わせる？
target: What do you say we meet?

source: （南上）セカンドラインを 具体化するなら あなたの顔を売って おきたかったんだけど
target: I wanted people to meet you, since you'll be overseeing the second line.

source: 冗談よ さあ顔を売って
target: I'm joking. Go make some friends and don't get into trouble.

source: 判事に顔を売ってきて
target: I want the man to know who you are.

source: お前と俺はこの顔を直すんだ！
target: Me and you are headed to fix this butterface.

source: 大姉様の顔を立てることを 知らないのかしら
target: How does that make our Big sister feel?

source: ここで顔を立てるんだ
target: You gotta make this look good.

source: いま ロシアの顔を立てておけば 後で何かと役に立つ
target: Helping the Russians save face is an act of good faith.

source: 車で40分のお袋の家に 顔を見せに来るどころか
target: He even has a problem with our mother taking Social Security and Medicare.

source: 億万長者のボスと そんな人はあまりいない 人前で彼らは素顔を見せてる
target: Not a lot of people show their real face in public.

source: メアリーのためにも 顔を貸してくださいよ
target: Come on. For Mary. Bring me your face.

source: それとも 人様に顔向けできないって思ったからですか
target: is it because you thought you couldn't bear to look other people in the face?

source: 君に顔向けできないと
target: Didn't want to face you.

source: それは願ってもない話だ オレはバカじゃないから丁度いい
target: It's a good thing I'm not a fool, then.

source: そうなったら願ってもない事だ。 だが、そうなる前に私のチームが私を救出するだろう。
target: Then that's what it'll be, or I hold out until my team comes to find me.

source: 実際 君の様な人は 願ってもないことだ
target: I mean, actually, I couldn't have even hoped as much for... Wow. Come on in.

source: どういう風の吹き回し？
