target: Baby, what's gotten into you?

source: 一体どういう風の吹き回しだ?
target: To what do I owe the pleasure?

source: どういう風の吹き回しだ？
target: You want me to- How am I supposed to do that?

source: 」 「風を切って走るのだ!
target: - Put some zing in it!

source: 彼のキャリアは風前の灯 その件が露見すると―
target: Liam's career was already hanging by a thread.

source: 俺はここで孤立無援で、 それも風前の灯だ！
target: I'm out on a limb here, and the limb is going to break!

source: 我々の命は風前の灯です
target: They're blowing it.

source: 士気はもはや 風前の灯火だ
target: Their courage hangs by a thread.

source: 風向きが悪い
target: That wind isn't good.

source: これは遺伝子医学に風穴を開ける 歴史的な発表になるだろう。
target: This will be a historical presentation that may open a new door to genetic medicine.

source: そうですか　お風邪を引かないように 気をつけてくださいね
target: I see, well... take care not to catch a cold. Thank you.

source: 僕 風邪を引いたので ティッシュはペンで取って
target: But I'd push the tissues off with a pen, if I were you, because I've had a cold.

source: 風邪を引くわ 着替えないと
target: He should get out of them wet clothes. He'll get sick.

source: 死人が甦るようになったら 食うか食われるかの世界になるぜ。
target: You know, in case the undead come back to life and the world gets all dog-eat-dog.

source: その後 父さんは言った 今は食うか 食われるかの世界だと
target: Anyway, after that, dad said this is the world we live in now -- eat or be eaten.

source: ♪ 食うや食わずの生活だけど ♪
target: # I ain't got much dough#

source: 航空機のエンジンも修理する 食えない物も調理する
target: They also fix airplane engines and cook bad food.

source: ステーキが食えないなら　ハンバーガーで 手を打つしかないさ
target: Well, if you can't get steak, you have to settle for hamburger.

source: 飽きが来るんだよ
target: It's like the— the law of diminishing returns.

source: どんなことでも 飽きが来るものよ
target: It's diminishing returns and whatever.

source: スタンディッシュ、私の首が危ないんだ。
target: Standish, the people want my head.

source: これで奴らの金庫は空っぽだ 税金で首が回らなくなる
target: So that means their coffers will be empty. They will be bled dry.

source: ピーターは首が回らなくなって 自衛のためにあなたに 自分を殺させた
target: Peter got in over his head and forced you to kill him to defend himself.

source: 首にした相手をけなすために
target: To vilify the boss that fired her.

source: 継母は使用人を全て 首にしました
target: Ella's stepmother dismissed the household.

source: 暴力団同士の抗争が続くと 私は首になる
target: Brass are gonna fire me just as soon as this gang war cools off.

source: これで どうにか 首の皮一枚 つながったな
target: You escaped by the skin of your teeth.

source: 良かった　率直に言って 君は首の皮一枚だよ
target: Good, because frankly, you're hanging by a thread.

source: 首を振るな
target: Don't shake your head at me.

source: 首を振って去る
target: Oh go on, then: shake your head and walk out.

source: これからは うなずくか、首を振るだけでいいわ わかった？
target: So, from now on, just nod or shake your head, okay?

source: 何でも首を突っ込む あのオバサンが悪いの
target: Don't feel sorry for yelling at that snoopy old bitch. She's been sticking her nose where it don't belong.

source: おたくの領域に 首を突っ込むつもりはないんですよ
target: We're not looking to horn in on your turf.

source: 首を突っ込みすぎだ
target: If you stick your neck out how far?

source: お前が首を縦に振らないせいで 廃墟になった場所だ
target: Your absolute unwillingness to accept anything less than everything.

source: 自動化やコストカットを いくら勧めても 首を縦に振らない 立派な職人さんだったが 私の言うことさえ聞いていれば
target: He was an admirable craftsman who refused to take my advice no matter how much I tried. he wouldn't have had to commit suicide.

source: 首を長くして　提灯を待ってる人も いるんだよ
target: There are others desperate for a foot massage, you know.

source: 首を長くして待ってたわ 結局パパはあきらめたけど
target: We waited and waited. Finally dad gave up

source: エリックとも馬が合う
target: She gets along with Eric really well.

source: 何所の馬の骨だ　何の話だ？
target: I don't fucking know you. What business?

source: うん　馬子にも衣装
target: Right, even a loser can dress for success.

source: 骨がありそうな男だな
target: You look like the kind of man who'd put his mettle to it.

source: この作業は― 骨が折れそうだ
target: The chances of this working... are remote at best.

source: あそこに骨を埋める気は
target: Not left out there to rot.

source: 化学療法だけでなく アリバイ工作も高くつき―
target: After completing my first round of treatment and financing the world's most expensive alibi?

source: ‐クリーニング代は高くつくぞ ‐行くぞ
target: - My dry-cleaning bill will be ridiculous. - Come on.

source: 高くつく・・・
target: It's just that he's a fortune to get here and...

source: 彼は軍事兵器システムを ハッキングして オークションハウスのように 高く買う落札者順に
target: Began selling data to the highest bidder like it was some sort of auction house or something.

source: 「他にも、もっと高く買ってくれる人がいるかも」
target: I bet someone else would pay more.

source: 高く買うヤツを知ってる
target: I know a guy that'll pay premium for this kind of crap.

source: でも　私は黙って高みの見物だわ
target: But you know I'm still on the fence at best.

source: 皆が競争するのを 君は高みの見物してた
target: You went high when everyone else stayed on the trail.

source: 花火に火をつけて　高みの見物？
target: Light the blue touchpaper and then retire?

source: あきらめろ　高嶺の花だ
target: That woman is out of your league. She's just too classy for you.

source: おまえには　高嶺の花だ
target: You are way out of your league.

source: アンジェラの事は忘れろよ お前には高嶺の花だ
target: Will you forget about Angela? She's a bad investment.

source: 髪を下ろしました
target: I let my hair down.

source: ♪髪を下ろしてみて♪
target: ♫ Let your hair hang... ♫

source: 鬱憤を晴らしてるだけよ
target: It's just people letting off steam.

source: ＦＢＩは鬼門だったな
target: Well, that was when the team made video games, not weapons.

source: （男性）鬼門って言われてんだから うちは
target: They say it's our fault.

source: あの山は鬼門だ
target: That mountain is evil.

source: 魂が抜けてる！
target: No. Her soul has left her body.

source: 魂が抜けたようになった
target: I became like a ghost.

source: 魔が差したの
target: And this was such a rush.

source: 人は魔が差して 危険を犯すものです
target: People are playing with fire and risk everything for nothing.

source: 魔が差したんでしょう
target: One weak moment, and you saw a way out.

source: 鳥肌が立ってます。
target: I've got goosebumps.

source: 鳥肌が立ってきた
target: I'm getting goosebumps.

source: 鳥肌が立ったわ
target: I got goose bumps, like.

source: ４年間 マニラで 鳴りを潜めてたが
target: Been out in the Manila Division the past four years, keeping my head down, minding my own business.

source: 何でも鵜呑みにするな
target: Jo, just 'cause he says it doesn't make it true.

source: そんな噂を鵜呑みにするな
target: Don't believe those rumors, man.

source: 鵜呑みにするか しないかだ
target: You just have to believe us or think that we're crazy.

source: 戦いをやり抜くには 信奉者を鼓舞するの
target: Kagame knew to inspire our followers is the only way to ensure our fight outlives us.

source: リバー８を鼓舞させたのよ
target: - He inspired Liber8.

source: 貴族たちを萎縮させ民を 鼓舞させる支配者
target: A monarch who can intimidate the high lords and inspire the people.

source: あなたの期待は、 この珍鳥がネズミに対して 鼻が利くことだ、と言って下さい
target: Say what you will, your rare bird has a nose for rodents.

source: 奴はヤバそうなことに　鼻が利く
target: Part of him always knew when his clock ran out, it wasn't gonna be pretty.

source: 鼻が曲がりそうだ
target: The smell is rough.

source: 鼻が高いわ
target: So important.

source: 鼻が高い　これで ワシを食べなきゃな
target: So smart, Mary Ann. Ha!

source: でもこいつらだけは 鼻を明かして刑務所に送ってやりたいの
target: But I sure as hell can catch the bastard behind all of this.

source: 奴らの鼻を 明かしてやればいい
target: Don't you want to beat those shitheads in front of everybody?

source: ５億損失の全ての原因だった というわけですね？ 私としても まったく いい迷惑です
target: I am extremely inconvenienced by all this as well.

source: 俺達はお呼びじゃ無い
target: We are not needed.

source: お呼びじゃないんだよ！
target: And you're not welcome!

source: "私はお呼びじゃ無い" それは分かる
target: I know I'm not wanted.

source: 男の扱いはお手の物だもんな？
target: And I think you'll find a way 'cause I think you know your way around men, don't you?

source: それはそれは ご立派な心掛けで
target: That's quite admirable of you.

source: 一歩進むごとに戦ったわ。 必死に働き、腕を磨き、上に立った。 誰にも迷惑かけずにね。
target: Every step of the way, I had to fight, to work hard, to get better, to come out ahead.

source: 上に立つため 下で働く事もある
target: Sometimes you have to serve in order to lead.

source: 人の上に立つのに必要です
target: That can be a virtue when it drives us to excel.

source: それに こういうのは あとから世に出たほうが 圧倒的に不利だ
target: And since they went public first, we'd be at a great disadvantage.

source: 何てことないですよ いつも叔父がお世話になってますから
target: - It's nothing, compared to your help with Uncle.

source: 世話を焼いても 返すのはグチばかり
target: She needs my help and then resents me for it.

source: いつからネスの世話を焼いてるの
target: Since when do you care about Renesmee?

source: バウアーは、不祥事を起こした薬である インターナショナルと 彼に対して行っ保証します。
target: Bauer is a disgraced agent with international warrants out against him.

source: お前は町に人狼が 戻ってきてると思うのか 揉め事を起こしに?
target: You think the werewolves are back in town trying to start some trouble?

source: 高尚な話をしてる割には あんたは　人を食い物にする 薬物中毒以外の何者でもない
target: Yeah, for all your high-minded talk, you're nothing but a predator and a drug addict.

source: 孤独な老人を 食い物にした 人でなしよ！
target: She was lonely and vulnerable, and you exploited her, you heartless shit!

source: でもガブリエルは人を食い物にしていた
target: But Gabriel was a predator.

source: かなりの人目を引く
target: It's quite striking in person.

source: 抗争により恋人達が その仲を裂かれる
target: It's about two star-crossed lovers kept apart by a big feud.

source: 体で覚えるんだ
target: I'm talking about muscle memory, girl...

source: 何はともあれ 成功した
target: For what it's worth, Colonel, it worked.

source: すべてを台無しにして彼の借りを返すの？ それがあなたの応える方法なの？
target: This is how you respond, by squandering your life to get even with him?

source: 借りを返すために...
target: For payback purposes...

source: 先が見える
target: I know what's gonna happen.

source: こういうのって 先が見えてるのよね
target: Don't you think I know how this goes?

source: だから先を読まれてた
target: That's how they were able to stay ahead of us.

source: ショーン　君から聞いた話だと 子供が生まれてから　リサが性的な面で 冷たくなったってことらしいね
target: Sean, what I'm hearing from you is that Lisa has become sexually cold ever since the baby was born.

source: 冷たくなってる
target: The bitch is cold, bro.

source: 子供たちを あなたの 原動力にしてください
target: Keep going and make your kids the engine of your life.

source: 自分の力にするために
target: It's what motivates me.

source: 限り、私は私の体に力を得たように、私はその命令に従います。
target: As long as I got strength in my body, I obey that order.

source: アンナはフィフス カラムが 力を付けて来たと考えている
target: Anna knows that the Fifth Column's growing stronger.

source: もっと力を付けた
target: The more firepower I got.

source: 在庫を抱えたまま 現金が減ると 途端に身動きが 取れなくなります
target: If the cash balance goes down while carrying an inventory, our cash flow will start to suffer right away.

source: お前のために危ない 橋を渡った
target: Listen, I've risked more than I should have for you, Jacq.

source: 俺は取るに足りない人間だ
target: I'm a nobody.

source: 受けて立つ
target: Guns blazing.

source: 受けて立とうぜ
target: I like the action.

source: 殺人は　人の口を封じる一つの手段だが
target: Murder is just one way to stop someone from talking.

source: アンダーソン　口を開くな 君はみんなのIQを下げてる
target: Anderson, don't talk out loud. You lower the IQ of the whole street.

source: 口数が多い 黙っていろ、運転を続けるのだ
target: Now shut up and keep driving.

source: ジル　ましな嘘をつけ
target: Jill, I'm not buying it.

source: もし今夜攻撃すれば 我らの人間性は地に落ちる
target: If we attack tonight Our humanity is lost.

source: あなたは自分に 壁を作ってる
target: - Yes. You spend a lot of time building walls, Hannibal.

source: マトリックスとは 夢の世界 人類を支配し 必要なものとして利用する
target: The Matrix is a computer-generated dream world built to keep us under control in order to change a human being into this.

source: 非現実的な夢を見ては それを乗り越えて来た
target: I wished for a lot of unrealistic things. - I got over them too.

source: お前に奈落の底へと...
target: I remember you tossing me into an abyss.

source: 完璧なチャーミング
target: "Is this perfect Child of heaven"

source: 核戦争回避の為の努力も実を結んでいません
target: All diplomatic efforts to avert Nuclear war have thus far failed.

source: どうする？ 俺の尻を叩く気か？
target: What are you gonna do?

source: あなたは左遷された身でしょう？
target: Look who's talking. You're the one who got put out to pasture.

source: 店を閉めて
target: Close the store.

source: しかし　それは 弱肉強食によって支配されます
target: But this one is governed by the law of the jungle.

source: 自然界は弱肉強食 適者生存よ
target: Nature adds and subtracts. Survival of the fittest.

source: 彼はいつも弱音を吐くの？
target: Does he always whine this much?

source: 君がたむろしているサークルは 多くの臆病者が弱音を吐いている
target: Maybe you've just been hanging out with too many timid and whiny people.

source: ...景気回復の見通しに 影を落としています
target: ...we wonder if evoking France's economic downturn might be premature?

source: 警察は後れを取っていた
target: Police are not prepared.

source: たぶん心が通じてると 言葉は不要なのかも
target: They probably don't have to speak because they're connected.

source: 心を入れ替えた
target: He's a whole new man.

source: 平静な表情から 簡単に心を許す人ではないと
target: The serenity of her countenance convinced me that her heart was not likely to be easily touched.

source: - この地域一帯の 911通報があったら 必ず連絡するよう念を押す
target: All right, check with dispatch, make sure they contact us if there's any 911 calls in the area.

source: 私は別の男性に 思いを寄せていますが 理由が判りません
target: I am having feelings for another man, and I don't know why.

source: 分析官は性に合ってる
target: This seemed like a better fit.

source: みんなの個性に合うようにそれぞれデザインしたの
target: I made this dress for you and I designed each outfit theme to perfectly reflect each pony's unique personality.

source: 破壊は息を呑んだよ
target: Destruction was breathtaking.

source: " きっと 愛想が尽きたのよ "
target: "I guess he just got tired of all the bullshit. "

source: 軍の余剰物に少し我を 忘れていたんだろう
target: I guess I got a little carried away at the Army Surplus.

source: 彼女の像を建てるために 5年と1000人の人手が掛かったわ
target: It took five years and a thousand men to build her temple.

source: 毎年　とても特別な人を指名する 研究室の助手になる人
target: Every year, I pick a very special someone to be my lab assistant.

source: 私たちには　人手も無ければ 専門知識も無かった
target: We just didn't have the people or the expertise.

source: 手を上げてろ
target: Hands up. What do you think you're doing?

source: 盾を捨てて、 手を上げろ！ あきらめろロージャス！
target: Drop the shield and put your hands in the air! Give it up, Rogers! Get that door open!

source: 手を伸ばす以外に何をする？
target: There's only one way to find out.

source: 死んだ後 手を入れてくれた
target: She's had a little work done.

source: 僕の場合 永久に手を切った
target: In my case, I am in it permanently.

source: 今日は この面接のために 神に祈ったりはしていません 手を合わせて 今ある命に 感謝しただけです
target: Today I didn't beg God for this job, just thanked him for this life

source: 手を合わせて悔い改めましょう
target: Put your hands together in contrition.

source: 手を合わせて フレディ・デントンのために 祈ってください
target: Now, you go home, clasp hands and pray for Freddy Denton's poor soul.

source: でも彼は　あなたじゃない あなたの友達よ 彼に手を差し伸べることを
target: And I don't think you should be afraid of helping him.

source: 明らかに 手を広げてる
target: Well, clearly he's branching out.

source: まあ　彼が手を広げない事を祈ろう
target: Well, let's just hope he doesn't decide to branch out.

source: 貴様となど手を組むものか！
target: I'll never join you!

source: 連中はみんな手を結んでる
target: They all work together.

source: - 手を貸すわ
target: Be happy to take care of it for her.

source: 現実に近づける 指をすり抜ける様に
target: Every time we get close to something real, it just slips through my fingers.

source: 持って生まれた物
target: It's in their nature.

source: さぁ ここを出て 持って生まれた力を 発揮して来なさい
target: Now, you get out there, and you do what you were born to do.

source: 記録の改竄です
target: I didn't know the records could be falsified.

source: 私が言った通りにしないと 彼に関する真実が 明るみに出るわ
target: You do everything I say or the truth about him will come out.

source: 朝飯前です
target: With my eyes closed.

source: 根に・・・　根に持ってませんよ　私
target: I'm not bitter, though.

source: 我々の宗教は この国に根を下ろさなかった
target: Our religion does not take root in this country.

source: 王政復古による 権力構造回帰の為に 民主主義に止めを刺す 彼等の真の狙いが裏にある
target: They're disguising what they really want, which is an end to democracy and a return to the imperialist power with all their old privileges restored.

source: 気が合うと良いんだけど
target: I hope I can reciprocate.

source: 前から気が合って
target: Tom and I have always gotten along.

source: 後で気が向いたらな アミン姉妹は？
target: Maybe later.

source: まぁ 置いておくので 気が向いたらどうぞ
target: Well, I'm just gonna leave it there in case you change your mind.

source: すっかり気が抜けて 注意を怠った　それが敗因だ
target: You stopped paying attention. And that's where you lost.

source: 何か気が抜けちゃったって言うか
target: I was discouraged by it, I mean...

source: そういう種類の友情は 気が抜けないものになるな。
target: That kind of friendship can keep you on your toes.

source: それは、気が早い、 まだ時間はある。
target: We're not there yet. There's still time.

source: 飛行機に乗るのは 気が進まなかったろう
target: I figure flying can't be too much fun for you.

source: ヘレン ウォーカーに会うのは あまり気が進まない
target: Not exactly looking forward to seeing Helen Walker.

source: どうも被害者の 家族の事が気に掛かる
target: and although my heart went out primarily to the families of the victims

source: - 運転は気を付けて
target: - You drive careful.

source: よく考えろ 君は気を失ったがヨルゲンと君の弟は −
target: Think about it. No one else fainted, only you.

source: 私には身体に気を遣わない 貴方って変に思えるわ
target: Strikes me as odd that you're not taking better care of yours.

source: パーティに 水を差すのは
target: - Well, I don't want to barge in on your party.

source: 主なる神の霊が わたしに臨んだ 主がわたしに油を注いで
target: The spirit of the Lord... is upon me, because he has anointed me... to preach good news to the poor.

source: 歩き始めると 戦闘の洗礼を受けた
target: From the time he could stand, he was baptized in the fire of combat.

source: だが彼は市の裏の部分 残忍さ暴力を浮き彫りにさせる
target: What that man does is carry out a dark reckoning for his city. It is a brutal, violent vision of justice, one we do not share.

source: これまでお前の為に色々な事を お前を守る為にして来た お母さんが亡くなってから
target: Sweetheart, everything that I've ever done was only to protect you after your mother had died.

source: "アラーは無辜の民を助けてくださる"
target: "Allah helps the innocent."

source: でもあなたと踊ってみて... なんか熱くなって仕方が無くて... だから...
target: But dancing with you got me all hot and bothered, so, you know...

source: 明日は熱くなってる必要がある
target: I know, it's working. I need to be angry tomorrow.

source: 俺の言う事を 信じるしかない... 狙いをつけてたのは 女じゃない
target: I mean, I get that you'll just have to take my word for this, but... she wasn't even the one I was aiming for.

source: しかし　わしの心は未だ一度も起こった事が 無いものに狙いをつけている
target: But my thoughts dwell on what has never been

source: シェリーが、彼にがっちり狙いを 定めているって噂よ
target: Because rumor has it Sherry's already staking her claim on him.

source: フリーランサーに狙いを定めてる
target: Got freelancer in my sights.

source: 登場人物の生の声を
target: After all, that's who I wrote it for.

source: その間にアメリカで最も 権力を持つ男になった
target: Along the way, he happened to become the most powerful man in the state.

source: 男になる為に？
target: To become a man?

source: どうかな　どんなふうに 効き目があるか分からない
target: I don't know. I don't see how that's gonna work.

source: 俺にはそういう才能を見抜く目があるんだ。
target: And I pride myself for having an eye for that kind of talent.

source: シルヴィアって 召使を選ぶ目があるのよ
target: Sylvia is so clever. She finds wonderful servants. I don't know how she manages.

source: 弱そうだから 見た目じゃないよ
target: It's about weakness and vulnerability. It's not a looks thing.

source: 組織は黒い蓮と呼ばれ ロンドンでも活動してる 君の目と鼻の先でな
target: A gang called the Black Lotus, operating here in London right under your nose.

source: その後２週間の間、我々は 彼を目にすることはなかった
target: And then we didn't see him for two weeks.

source: 見せろ どうせ目に入る
target: Show him. He'll find out soon enough.

source: 「一番近くの店に行き．．． ．．．目に入った最初のウォンカ・バーを買うんじゃ」
target: Run down to the nearest store and buy the first Wonka candy bar you see.

source: 私自身の怖れも 彼女の目に映っていた
target: And I could read my own terror in her eyes.

source: その通りだ 我々は海兵隊だ 我々の手で やつらに目に物見せてやろう
target: Marines, we are going to make our point, let them know who they're dealing with.

source: 君が失敗するのは 目に見えてる
target: but I'm afraid you're just gonna have to suffer its failure.

source: 他の魚も目を付けてたしね
target: Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.

source: ドローンに役目を 奪われたかな？
target: Drones taking all the cool assignments?

source: あの娘に目を奪われているのでしょ？
target: You adore this girl, don't you?

source: ドムが神の目を奪ったから レーダーから逃れるためだ
target: Because Dom took God's Eye, so we need to stay off the grid

source: わが目を疑うんだが 証拠を...
target: I don't believe this. Beatrix, I suppressed evidence.

source: どうしたら目を瞑っていれますか、アンドレ？
target: How can you be so blind, André?

source: 目を背けていたんだ
target: Your eyes were open, but you didn't want to see.

source: - 我々の会話は、ウィル、 君が本当は何者かという真実に、 君の目を開かせるということだけだ。
target: Our conversations, Will, were only ever about you opening your eyes to the truth of who you are.

source: アラーは望む... 最後には目を開いて 敵の顔を直視しろと
target: Allah wishes... that we finally open our eyes and look the enemy in the face.

source: 難しいけど いま話し合って 矛盾点の無いように
target: I know it's a difficult subject, but if we could just talk it out, and then we can decide whether or not to bring it up in the hearing.

source: そこで何をしていたか 知る由もないよな？
target: You didn't even know he was there, did you?

source: 寄宿学校に行ってたら知る由も無かったわ
target: I never would have known about it if I was at boarding school.

source: 私としたことが ...
target: I should have known...

source: 私としたことが 早く気づくべきだったわね
target: Can't believe I didn't recognize you earlier.

source: いやいや、不謹慎にも程があるっしょ、こういうことって。
target: No! That's a very serious thing to be kidding about.

source: それは、風穴をあける 唯一の方法だった 我々を田舎の場外取引店と 見なさなくなる
target: It was the only way these Wall Street pricks would ever stop thinking of us as some shitkicker bucket shop.

source: 穴をあける
target: We will clear a path!

source: どこかで 線を引く必要があった
target: we had to draw the line somewhere.

source: 重要なものとの間に 線を引いたの
target: No, I drew a line between the important stuff and that.

source: 縁起でもない　そんなに長生きして　どうする
target: Nonsense! I don't want to live that long.

source: - 罪がない？
target: - Innocent?

source: 彼は罪がない
target: He is innocent.

source: 彼らが最初 耳にしたのは 北方から近づく嵐の音だった
target: The first they heard was a noise like a hurricane... coming down from the North.

source: 記者の耳に入れたくない事でも？
target: Do you have something to hide from a reporter?

source: 天使の会話を耳に挟んだ
target: I've picked up chatter among the angels.

source: 俺たちはストリートに並んでいる 軍隊を背にして立っている 俺たちの友人だった奴らだ
target: We stood side by side against the dark forces on our streets, especially the ones who used to be our friends.

source: 私に背中を向けるな！
target: Don't you dare turn your back on me!

source: 誰にも背中を向けるな
target: Don't turn your back on anybody.

source: 彼に色目を使ってるなら
target: And if she's making those eyes at him,

source: あんたは血も涙もない上にバカよ
target: You are cruel and ignorant.

source: 裏切られ 血を見ることになる！
target: When they turn on us -- and they will -- that blood is gonna be on your hands!

source: 彼女はその日 多くの血を見た。
target: She saw a lot of hurt that day.

source: 奴らを俺達に近づけるな さもなくば、血を見ることになる
target: You'd better keep them away from us... or there will be bloodshed.

source: 現場では常に― こちらの裏を かこうとする敵が相手だ
target: In the field, you will face off against enemies who are always one step ahead of you.

source: 多少の危険は覚悟の上よ
target: To me, that's worth a little risk.

source: 言葉を返して申し訳ないが　今は 詳細な情報を口にすべき 時期でもないし場所でもない
target: With all due respect, this is not the time or the place to share the details.

source: 協力する限り、俺は話が分かる男だ、 一言聞くぜ、リック。
target: I'm a very reasonable man as long as you cooperate, so let me ask you a question, Rick.

source: 救世主は話が分かるんだ。
target: Saviors can actually be quite reasonable.

source: それとこれとは話が違う
target: Look, you can't be doing this right now.

source: 調子に乗りすぎたよ この年頃の小さな子供ってこうだろう
target: I shouldn't have encouraged her, but you know what little children are like these days.

source: このやり方は諸刃の剣だぞ
target: This little game cuts both ways.

source: だが、豹変するだろう
target: You wait till it turns ugly.

source: 赤くなっちゃった このワインのせいね
target: I'm flushed. Must be the wine.

source: 赤くなった
target: Are you blushing?

source: ＜新しい ショコラティエが オープンして 足を運ばないわけがない＞
target: If a new chocolatier opens up, there's no way she won't stop by.

source: 俺に身を任せろ
target: I need you to trust me.

source: この春　自分　身を固めようと思いまして
target: My girlfriend and I, we're thinking of settling down.

source: 頼む、同じ轍を踏むな、いいな？
target: Please, don't go down this road again, ok?

source: 途方に暮れたよ 子連れで文無し 定職もない
target: I didn't know how I was going to manage with a small boy, with no money and no regular job.

source: 光の中　俺のために道が開いている
target: I shall revel in that fire! In that fire I shall find my bride!

source: いろんな道が開けてきました 両親に教わらなかったことも
target: It helped expose me to things that my parents or friends didn't show me.

source: あれほど釘を刺したろ
target: You did exactly what I told you not to do!

source: 一度も音を上げなかった
target: That not for a single moment did his courage waver.

source: わかった、じゃあ頭から
target: All right. From the top.

source: 2003初頭からMIA 戦死者扱いだった だが もう違う
target: MIA since early 2003 and presumed dead... until now.

source: ３年生の頭から 監督に謝りに行って
target: So at the beginning of my third year... I went and apologized to my coach and asked to start all over again.

source: あなた方　捜査官には 頭が下がるけれど
target: The Agency appreciates everything your people are doing.

source: そんなに頭が切れるなら 何故ここに来たの？
target: Then why'd you come up here if you're so smart?

source: "私が頭が痛くても" "痛い顔したり" "声 出したり"
target: Even if my head hurts, no one knows until I cry.

source: 頭に入れておきます　ありがとう
target: I put it on my to do list ". Thanks.

source: 地図は頭に入れておけ
target: Next time stay put, you won't need a map.

source: 俺達が頭を下げたのはドラゴンだ そしてドラゴンはもう死んだ！
target: It was the Dragons we bowed to and now the Dragons are dead!

source: 友よ... 君達は... 誰にも 頭を下げなくていい
target: My friends you bow to no one.

source: 頭を冷やそう　ここじゃ無理だ 名前は？
target: Chill out. Can we just talk about this? What's your name?

source: 頭を冷やしてくる
target: I need some air.

source: ベイビー　よく顔を見せて
target: - Oh my baby! - You're really here. - Let me look at you.

source: 2度と顔を見せるなと言ったのに また帰ってきた こいつと こそこそと...
target: I told you never to show your face here again but here you are... snooping around with this...

source: あいつは食えない奴だ
target: Well, george is capable of a lot of things.

source: 君は本当に食えない女だな
target: You are so full of shit, Patty.

source: あと 2人の首が 飛ぶのね
target: That means two more heads are about to roll.

source: 優しいな　どうでもいいが 誰かに首にされたとして
target: That's very kind to say. Unless it stopped being a job because someone fired you, in which case...

source: −君は私を首にする。
target: - You are firing me.

source: 「仕事を首になって アパートから追い出された」
target: "I got fired from my job. I got kicked out of my apartment."

source: お前が首になったのは お前自身のせいだ
target: I didn't lose your job for you, Wade, you did that.

source: 急いだ方が良いぞ 副大統領が皆の首を切ろうとしてる
target: And it better be soon, because the Vice President's about to fire us all.

source: ところが君は生活の為に オマハで人の首を切りに行った
target: Instead you went to Omaha to fire people for a living?

source: 彼は君を首を長くして待っているぞ
target: he's been waiting for you a real long time,man.

source: どこの馬の骨だ バーニー？
target: Who is this bimbo, Barney?

source: 何所の馬の骨だ　何の話だ？
target: I don't fucking know you. What business?

source: お前は馬の骨だった
target: I didn't know you at all.

source: 僕の ビジネスパートナーなら 気骨がある所を 見せてみろ！
target: If you are to become my business partner, Macduff, you've got to start showing some backbone!

source: 彼女は鉄の気骨がある
target: That girl has an iron backbone.

source: 取り調べは徹底的で 骨が折れ 退屈な作業だ
target: The checking of the suspects had been thorough, painstaking, and tedious.

source: 強敵を見つけるには 骨が折れるが
target: Though, you know, finding a worthy opponent has been a little challenging.

source: 僕は移住はしない この国に骨を埋める
target: No, I reject this idea of abandoning my country.

source: せっかくですが私は この銀行に 骨を埋める所存でおります
target: but I intend to stay at this bank for the rest of my career.

source: 彼らの為に骨を折った事がある、 法的に言えば、5年の刑のを。
target: Oh, I've been pulling their chestnuts out of the fire, legally speaking, for five years.

source: 君を弁護するとすれば、 君が何も見えない様に私が骨を折ったのだ。
target: In your defense, I worked very hard to blind you.

source: 一つ骨を折ってみよう
target: I will see what we can do.

source: マスター・スカイウォーカーは鼻が高いでしょう
target: Master Skywalker should be proud.

source: フェニックス 灰の中から生まれ変わる不死鳥だ
target: Phoenix. Risen from the ashes.

source: あんた 人が変わったみたい
target: You seem like a changed person.

source: この２人が　悪い奴で
target: Yes. Uh, those two are the bad guys.

source: 進歩は始まらないよ 夢の意味を認めらないまま
target: You won't make any progress... until you recognize your dreams for what they are.

source: 考えてみてくれ 長椅子に寝ていても何も始まらない
target: I'm not gonna get over anything by just lying on the couch. It's not a good idea.

source: 他の誰かが彼女の手を取っていたらいやだな
target: I don't like someone else's hands on my girls.

source: だから、ちょうど私から手を取るのだろうか？
target: So will you just take your hands off me?

source: サー・マンドンは王の旗を掲げろ
target: Ser Mandon, you will bear the King's banner.

source: 休暇を取ったと 聞きましたが
target: I was told that she requested emergency leave.

source: 何を心配してるの 純資産が　標的になるの？
target: What, are you worried that your net worth makes you a target?

source: 世界刑事裁判所の代表として 標的になるのが私の役目だ
target: the head of the world criminal court, it would make sense for me to be a target.

source: 限界を見失う前に 標的になる前に
target: Before you lose your edge, before you become a target.

source: 指が硬くなってる
target: From here the tension passes on to your fingers.

source: それ聞いたあと学校に 行く息子の身になってもみろって
target: Imagine going to school with that in your head.

source: 弁護側は "被告の身になって" と言うでしょう
target: The defense would have you walk in his client's shoes.

source: だから 誰かの 身になって考えるなら どうか グロリアさんの 身になって考えて
target: So if you are gonna put yourself in anyone's shoes... put yourself... in Gloria Mitchell's.

source: オーディションに落ちたのは 幸いなんだよ パーティーでの演奏なんて 頭が痛いぞ
target: Believe me, Marty, you're better off without having to worry about all the aggravation and headaches of playing at that dance.

source: 最悪の状況で頭が痛いです
target: I'm getting a bad feeling about where this is headed.

source: では いい子になるのよ
target: Now remember, Pinocchio, be a good boy.

source: お呼びじゃないでしょ
target: And he didn't invite me.

source: 彼 お呼びじゃないわ
target: He hasn't called.

source: 騎兵隊はお呼びでないか？ そうだ
target: No cavalry comin'?

source: それはそれは
target: That's... That's awkward.

source: それは それは良かった - クソ
target: That's-- that's good, right?

source: それはそれは常にされています方法です。
target: That's the way it's always been.

source: エンジンが 掛からない
target: It won't start.

source: 俺の頭に メスを入れようとするんだ
target: They're going to cut into my brain.

source: 地雷の上に立ってる。
target: He's standing on a mine.

source: 光の輝く柱の上に立つ
target: He'd be standing atop a shining pillar of light.

source: 私は、見たのよ。 アストラを。 ナイフを持って、 ジョンの上に立ってた。
target: - I saw Astra standing over J'onn.

source: この世に出てくるため自分の母親を殺したお前が？
target: You, who killed your mother to come into the world?

source: 本当にお世話になりました
target: You've taken real good care of me.

source: 彼の世話になった
target: - Sonny -- he, uh -- you know, he looked after me.

source: （なな恵） 同じ寮で と っ ても お世話になった綾さんだった
target: It was Aya from the same dorm. Who really took care of me.

source: お前が育つにつれ　世話を焼いた
target: And as you grew up I cared for you still, made you a nice bed for your slumbers.

source: お前が育つにつれ　世話を焼いた
target: And as you grew up I cared for you still, made you a nice bed for your slumbers.

source: 誰かが親切に世話を焼いたんだね。 だれかが　しんせつに　せわをやいたんだね Someone must've helped you
target: Someone must've helped you

source: あの晩 雨の中に立って
target: I was standing there that night in the rain.

source: ああ、だが君も見ただろ 中性子ビームの中に立っていた
target: Well, you saw it yourself, standing in those neutron beams.

source: ど真ん中に立ってた
target: I was standing right in the middle of it.

source: ある時点から　地球は丸くなったということだ
target: At one point, so was the Earth being round.

source: アイツがマイクロボットを盗んで 火事を起こしたんだ
target: He stole my microbots, he started the fire.

source: 火事を起こしちゃいない
target: You didn't start the fires.

source: 賛同する仲間は 数百いる ここで事を 起こす事だって
target: We can mobilize hundreds more behind you, it could get pretty messy in here, Mr. Randol.

source: それが　癌みたいに主人を 食い荒らしていったの
target: It ate him up like a cancer.

source: 人を食うことが 気色悪いのは分かる
target: I know it's pretty damn weird to eat people.

source: 人を食う木箱の怪物
target: Things coming out of crates and eating people?

source: 仮面を被っていた
target: Said they were masked.

source: 男は仮面を被っていた
target: Men wore masks.

source: 彼女との仲を裂き
target: You just want to scare me so I'll split!

source: こんどはその借りを 返してもらうこととしますか
target: It holds fair now you return the favour.

source: ラニスターは必ず借りを返す
target: The Lannisters pay their debts.

source: 信じてないよね？ 借りを返すべき 存在なんて
target: You don't really think there's someone out there holding my I.O.U.

source: もう少し先が見える
target: Just a little further.

source: 行き先が見えてるから
target: Cause I know where I'd be going.

source: 先が見えた
target: I see daylight.

source: 先を読んで
target: Read on.

source: ※冷たくならないって素敵よね。
target: It must be nice, never getting cold.

source: 天候が変わって冷たくなった
target: The weather has turned cold

source: 何か食べてください 食べ物は冷たくなっています
target: Have something to eat. The food is getting cold.

source: 割に合わない投資は嫌いだ
target: I hate bad investments.

source: 割に合うなら良いけど・・ 進んで
target: I hope it turns out to be worth the expense.

source: 今すぐ電力を付けなきゃ
target: We've got to get the power back on now.

source: [電力を落とす]
target: [electricity powering down]

source: 我々が電力を落としたんです
target: We cut your power.

source: 身動きが取れなかった
target: And I was tangled in...

source: 今、2台の車に囲まれて 身動きが取れない
target: We're about ready to be boxed in by two cars.

source: 身動きが取れない
target: They've got us pinned in.

source: 他の飛行機とは勝手が違うから。
target: This isn't like other planes.

source: 外とは勝手が違うが 心配するな
target: Don't be alarmed. You will notice that things work differently here.

source: 英国とは勝手が違うでしょ？
target: Yes, well, I'm sure things are very different in England.

source: 至福なるこの飲み物を 口にすれば 煩悩のない 永遠の命を得られる
target: One sip of this heavenly brew will give ever-lasting life... free from mortal suffering and desire.

source: コーヒーにタバコと コカの葉しか口にしなくて
target: He's been on a diet of coffee, tobacco, and coca leaves.

source: ヒトラーは三千年のドイツ帝国を口にする。 だが、１ヶ月も軍隊を養えない。
target: Hitler speaks of a 1,000-year Reich, but he cannot feed his armies for a month.

source: 口を開いて "あー"って言って
target: Open your mouth. Say, "Ah."

source: 口を開いたら、
target: If you open your mouth,

source: その口を開くんだ
target: Open your damn mouth.

source: 右から左
target: Right one over the left.

source: レポートによると 右から左への軌道ね
target: The directionality on the report showed a right-to-left trajectory.

source: 姓も名もない"ドクター"だ　いつの時代も
target: No first name, no last name, just the Doctor. Always the Doctor.

source: 名もなき者
target: You have no name.

source: 以前　彼らはあなたを 名もなき男と呼んでいた
target: They used to call you the Man with No Name.

source: イサドラ・ダンカンから名を取った 84カラットのダイヤだよ
target: 84 carats, named for Isadora Duncan.

source: やり方を心得ていれば 新しい名を取るより大変ではない
target: No harder than taking a new name if you know the way.

source: トーマスと名付けたいわ 祖父の名を取って
target: I want to name him Thomas after my grandfather.

source: "木も成長するときに軟らかく－" "渇き固くなるのは死ぬときなのだ"
target: When a tree is growing, it's tender and fragile, but when it's dry and hard, it dies.

source: 手足が動かせなくなり 筋肉がセメントのように 固くなり 静脈が氷のように感じる
target: You lose control over your limbs, the muscles harden into cement, and it feels like ice in your veins.

source: 呼び鈴が 固くなったでしょ?
target: Then why did your doorbells get so hard?

source: 数千人の超人が地に落ちて どこから手をつければ良いやら
target: Thousands of superpowered dicks touching down, and we got no idea where to start.

source: 旗は遂に地に落ちた
target: The banner toppled and fell to the Earth

source: 魔法使いが地下に潜る前 まだ魔女狩りがあったころ
target: It was before wizards went underground, when we were still being hunted by Muggles.

source: 山は越えられん 地下に潜ろう
target: We cannot pass over a mountain. Let us go under it.

source: そいつが地下に潜ったんだ
target: And it dove down there. Down underground.

source: お前たちが勝手に壁を作って自分のものにしたんだ
target: You lot came along and just put up a big wall and said it was yours.

source: 我らの先祖がギリシャから 運ばれた石でこの壁を作った
target: Our ancestors built this wall, using ancient stones from the bosom of Greece herself.

source: 父親は 遮断壁を作って 外で死んだそうだ
target: He died outside, when he was making the barrier.

source: "良い実を結ばぬ木は、どんな木でも 切り倒され、火に投げ込まれる"
target: "every tree that no bringeth forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire."

source: 私たちの花が咲く... そして我々は実を結ぶ。
target: Our flowers blossom... and we bear fruit.

source: いのちの木があり １２種の実を結び その実は毎月実っていた "
target: "which bears 12 manner of fruit and yielded her fruit every month."

source: - テレルはお尻を叩かれてる
target: - Terrell is gettin' his ass beat.

source: 私のお尻を叩いた？
target: And then they spanked me?

source: わざと泣かせる為に 赤ちゃんのお尻を叩くんだ
target: Well, they spank all little babies 'cause they're trying to get them to cry.

source: 見通しのいい場所から 目印の山が　見えるはずさ。
target: If we find a better spot, I might be able to see the mountains.

source: 山が見えたぞ
target: I lead you to the Mountain.

source: 幕が開いてすぐに―
target: As soon as that curtain opened,

source: アタシ　いつもショーの幕が開く前に タバコを吸うから
target: I always smoke a cigarette before the first show.

source: あなたは多くの配当を得た
target: It created a dividend in the amount of...

source: 後ろを見せろ
target: Mind showing me what's in back?

source: 帰り道に息を吐かないで
target: Don't exhale on the way out.

source: 息を吐いて
target: Good. And exhale.

source: （息を吐く）
target: (exhales)

source: 息を吹き返した ばかりでした
target: I mean, I was still just trying to breathe.

source: （息を呑む）
target: (GASPS)

source: (息を呑む) こいつ知ってますよ
target: (gasps) I know that dude.

source: アブ ナジールの写真を渡した時 彼は息を呑んでました ほんの数秒間
target: When you turned over that picture of Abu Nazir... he stopped breathing for a few seconds.

source: 実際に　殆ど我を忘れてた
target: Actually, it mostly missed me.

source: 拍手が無かったのはアナタのせいでは
target: It wasn't your fault that they didn't applaud.

source: 遺体には手が無い
target: The body was missing a hand.

source: ソイツらの1人は 手がなかった
target: Roy: One of the guys was missing a hand.

source: 手が焼けるようで、手を顔に当てた
target: Felt a burning sensation on my hands, put my hands up to my face.

source: さっき、手にしていた 本の事です
target: Struwwelpeter, the book that you had in your hand.

source: 手にしてる石は何？
target: The stone in your hand. What is it?

source: - なに？ - もし仮に指が　3本しか使えなくて そっちの手もないのよ
target: If you had these three fingers missing on this hand and that hand missing on that hand...

source: 手を上げて！
target: Hands where I can see them, now!

source: 手を上げて　今度は下げて
target: ♪ Hands wave up then come down ♪

source: くだらないと思ってる人は 手を上げて
target: Who thinks this is silly? Raise your hand.

source: あなたの手を伸ばし。
target: Reach out your hand.

source: 瞬間を捕らえようと 手を伸ばす
target: ♪ Who's reachin' out to capture a moment?

source: 手を伸ばすが、棘（とげ）に刺される 3滴の血が滴り
target: Reaching for it, she pricked her finger and three drops of blood fell.

source: でも、時々その穴に手を入れ
target: But sometimes, he reaches in that hole

source: 僕のポケットに手を入れて?
target: Would you mind slipping your hand into my pocket?

source: 手を入れて 携帯を取るんだ
target: Get your hands in, get your hands in and get the phone.

source: 君は　言ったね 自分の部屋で窓を開けようとして 手を切ったと
target: You said that... you cut your hand trying to open a window in your room.

source: - 窓から 手を切らなくても なんとか開けられたよ
target: Somehow I managed to open it without slicing my hand.

source: その手を切ったのはオレじゃねえ アニキが自分でやったんだ
target: I didn't cut off your hand, neither. You did that.

source: 歌手を加えるのも一案だ
target: Maybe we should take on a singer.

source: 頭の後ろ手で両手を合わせて 指を組んで
target: Please put your hands behind your head for me, please, lock your fingers.

source: 手を合わせてくれる？
target: Oh! Can you give me five, Marco?

source: 簡単だよ　手を合わせるんだ こんな風に　いい?
target: It's so easy. Take this hand in my hand. Like this, see?

source: タックルするために全部使った 手を回してそいつをタックルするけど...
target: All I got to do is tackle him, put my hands around him and tackle him, but...

source: でも、歴史のページの中でごくたまに... ...とんでもない運命が手を差し伸べることがある。
target: But in the pages of history, every once in a while, fate reaches out and extends its hand.

source: 主はその手を広げ あなたを迎え入れます
target: The Prince of Peace opens his arms to you.

source: 猿の足のように　君の手を 広げて閉じるのが好きだ
target: And I love the way your hands open up and close, like monkey paws.

source: 調べるから両手を広げろ
target: You wanna put your arms out to your sides for me, if you would?

source: 物を作りたければ 手を汚すものだ
target: You want to make things, you got to get your hands dirty.

source: 外に出て手を汚してもいい
target: And it's okay to go outside and get your hands dirty.

source: 両手を組んで横たわってた ゾッとしたよ
target: She was lying there with her arms crossed, all creepy-like.

source: 私達　手を組むべきよ
target: We should hold hands.

source: 彼女は両手を組んでいた
target: With her arms crossed.

source: 手を結んだまま、
target: My hands were still tied behind my back, and I...

source: あいつの足と手を結んで おいておけ、そして先に逃げる それから、警察を呼びその場所を教える
target: We'll hog-tie him with duct tape, and we'll dump him out, and hit the road, and I'll call the cops, tell 'em where we left him.

source: 羽を持って生まれたかどうかだ 一生見張ってるつもり？
target: You're either born with wings or not. _ _

source: 足ヒレを持って生まれた！
target: We were born with flippers.

source: 全く同じ遺伝子を持って生まれた ２つの生物の違いを研究したくてさ
target: I need to study the difference between two specimens born into the world with exactly the same genetic material.

source: 日の目を見る為にここへ来た
target: Came out here for the sunshine.

source: 俺を殺すくらい朝飯前か？
target: Can they kill me before breakfast?

source: 朝飯前の練習かな
target: I don't know. A three-hour low-rate technical row before breakfast.

source: 多分今日も朝飯前に また誰かを脅した。
target: He probably threatened someone before breakfast this morning.

source: 屋根を下ろしてってことか?
target: Put the top down?

source: 危険なのは乗客も同じだ しかも人数の桁が違う
target: So are my passengers. In greater numbers.

source: この件を彼に代わって　棚上げにすることか？
target: Do you reach things off high shelves for this one?

source: 十分空気が 抜けたと思うが
target: I think you're aired out enough.

source: 血の気が　抜けちまった。
target: I have lost a lot of blood.

source: 喉をまっすぐ　ゆっくり慎重に 切り開いている 被害者の瞳から生気が抜けていくのを 観察することができるようにね
target: He slits their throats slowly, carefully, so he can watch the life drain out of their eyes.

source: 普通　空気の取り入れ口は　１つよ 冷たい空気を入れるためには １つか２つでいい
target: There's usually one vent for intake, and then maybe one or two to blow cold air.

source: 電気を入れてみる。
target: I got to turn the main power switch back on.

source: 新鮮な空気を入れるよ
target: You want my air? Here. Take mine.

source: 全部秘匿されたが 俺は見つけた ケラーは氷山の一角にすぎない
target: It was all buried, but I found it, and Keller was just the tip of the iceberg.

source: 〈今日のように 暑い日は―〉 〈機械に油を 注ぐようなもの〉 〈酒の回りも速い〉
target: Hot day like today too much oil in the machine can cause it to blow a gasket.

source: 潤滑油を注ぐためだ
target: There's always a way to oil everyone's lock.

source: 波に乗るんだ ニューヨーク！
target: Surf's up, New York!

source: 最後に彼女を見たのは 3日前だ 夕方 デボンポイントで 波に乗った時だ
target: I saw Chris three days ago-- sunset patrol at Devon point break.

source: あと１回波に乗ってやめます
target: I'm gonna catch one last one. Thanks.

source: イエス・キリストの名によって 洗礼を受け...
target: Ye have prayed that our Lord, Jesus Christ, would vouchsafe to receive her.

source: ビスケイン湾で 洗礼を受ける
target: He's taking the holy spirit on right there in the waters of the Biscayne Bay.

source: 君が留守の間に、私は父から洗礼を受けた
target: Father consecrated me while you were away.

source: 魔女が家に火を付けた時 私は5歳でした
target: I was five years old when witches set our house on fire.

source: 火を付けようぜ
target: ♪ We could start a fire

source: 彼が出たら　葉巻に火を付ける
target: I will light my cigar when he's coming out.

source: 心が熱くなるのを体で感じる
target: I'd feel this heat rising inside of me,

source: 耳が熱くなり始める 次回に連絡する
target: I'll be in touch the next time my ear starts burning.

source: 聞いてくれ　実は 会議中に数回あったんだが 使ってもいない自分の携帯電話が 熱くなるんだ
target: Listen, the, um -- the thing is, several times now, in meetings, uh, my phone gets hot even though I haven't used it, you know, like it's been on the whole time,

source: だが　君は... 君は銃に狙いをつけた
target: But you... you aimed the gun.

source: Cause I'm carefully aimed for the liver 慎重に肝臓に狙いをつけて
target: First I carefully aim for the liver

source: 2インチ高く 狙いをつけられなかったの？
target: You couldn't have aimed 2 inches higher?

source: ディグは外で狙いを定めてる
target: Dig's got a shot lined up outside.

source: 一つの矢の狙いを 定める事ができたのを疑う
target: I doubt you could aim a single arrow.

source: でも　狙いを定めないと
target: But I have to aim.

source: 訓練生の声が 合成されてる 全員の場合もあるし 2人だけの時もある 合成には ここのサーバーを使ってるわ
target: It's our voices braided together, sometimes all of us, sometimes two of us, and they're running through a server here inside this building.

source: （安藤） 今... 切れた電話 吉森先生の声だったような
target: The phone got cut off, but the caller sounded like Yoshimori.

source: 掛けるとスタントン夫人の 生の声ではなく
target: Tried reaching Mrs. Stanton by phone, but no one's answering.

source: 用を足してくる
target: I need to send a fax to Cleveland.

source: 男が立ってる
target: He's right in front of you!

source: 驚かすつもりはないが 君の後ろに 変な男が立ってる
target: Um, I don't want to alarm you right now, but there's a fucking creepy dude standing right behind you.

source: よかった　どんな反応を すればいいかわからないが いい男になったみたいだ
target: Great, I really don't know how to respond to that where I come out looking like a good guy.

source: 踊りの師匠のになることも特別なことだ しかし顔のない男になることは― 次元が違う
target: To be a dancing master is a special thing, but to be a faceless man-- that is something else entirely.

source: そうしたら俺は四半分男になるだけだ
target: That would make me the Quarterman.

source: 目があって気がついたの... ...わたしにとって 意味のある相手だって
target: I looked into his eyes, and he looked into mine, and I just felt he had a great deal left to do with his life.

source: 少なくとも　僕はまだ両目がある
target: Well, at least I still have my eyes.

source: この目がある
target: These two eyes... That's it.

source: あなたはもう 盲目じゃなくなる
target: You can't be anymore blind.

source: 愛は盲目じゃないけど バカバカしいことは　よくある
target: Well, love is not blind. It's often pretty stupid.

source: 俺は盲目じゃない
target: I'm not blind.

source: 血が目に入って前が...
target: I can't see! I got blood in my...

source: （カオル） ライトが目に入っちゃって
target: The light hit my eye.

source: 太陽が目に入って もっと遠くにいると 勘違いしました
target: Uh -- the sun was in my eyes and I thought you were a lot further away from me.

source: 目に映る唯一の光源は 廊下の窓の光
target: Gazing at the only light source outside in the corridor.

source: 目の毒物学 視神経の形態
target: "Toxicology of the Eye." "Morphology of the Optic Nerve."

source: キリストに目を向けなさい　リー
target: Turns your eyes to Christ, Leigh.

source: たぶん片目を奪うつもりだ
target: Probably take out one of her eyes.

source: すぐに、君の目を奪う 盲目の女が地下で 生存することは出来ない
target: We take your eyes now... and see how long a blind girl can survive in the basement.

source: 両目を奪われた
target: They took my eyes.

source: 私の目を盗んだ
target: They took my eyes.

source: しっかり目を見張るのよ
target: KEEP YOUR EYES OPEN.

source: 目を逸らさせる為
target: Now if you look here,

source: 目を逸らしちゃいけないの スネイプは瞬きもしなかったわ
target: You've got to keep eye contact, and Snape wasn't blinking.

source: 朝目を開く瞬間
target: Mornings, in the moment I woke up...

source: 目を開いて　まだ使えるわ
target: You open the eyes, they still work.

source: 両目を開いてしっかり見るんだ
target: When you're aiming, Casey, always keep both eyes open.

source: ゲートに穴をあけて 通信を確立するんだ そうしたら設計図が送信できる
target: You've got to tell them to blow a hole in the shield gate so we can transmit the plans

source: 頭に穴をあけてもう一人死んだかも
target: We risk losing another by drilling through his head,

source: 我々は敵編隊に穴をあける
target: We will drill a hole through this swarm!

source: 夜中に穴を埋め 建てつづけた
target: Worked by night, filled the hole, and kept building.

source: 鉛筆を持ち　太い線を引く それから細い線
target: You know, you take a pencil, and you make a dark line... then you make a light line.

source: 時計台のてっぺんから 電線を引いて 2本の電柱の間に このように張る
target: We run industrial-strength electrical cable from the top of the clock tower down, suspending it over the street between these two lampposts.

source: どっちが別名だ 君はお父さんのリストに 線を引いて消した
target: Which is another name you crossed off your dad's list.

source: じゃないと俺は無職だ またモトクロスのレースに戻っちゃう でも犯罪がない世界のためなら全部捨てる
target: If it wasn't, I'd be out of a job, but I'd give it up tomorrow to live in a world without crime.

source: まったく罪がない？
target: Wholly without sin?

source: - フィル、耳が痛いわ
target: - Phil, this hurts my ears.

source: 気圧の変化で 耳が痛いんです
target: The altitude's building pressure in her ears.

source: 耳が痛い！
target: My ear!

source: これを耳に入れれば 俺からの指示が聞こえる
target: Put this in your ear, you'll be able to hear me talking to you the whole time.

source: これを耳に入れろ
target: Put this in your ear.

source: また舌を耳に入れたのかな
target: What's wrong? Should I put my tongue in your ear now?

source: 人に　ものを聞かせたければ 手で肩を叩いてもダメだ
target: Wanting people to listen... you can't just... tap them on the shoulder anymore.

source: 肩を叩かれた者は―
target: All the soloists I tapped:

source: その後　アシスタントのコーチが来て 僕を捕まえた パパが僕の肩を叩いて車に行った 彼は何も言わずに怒ってたかなんかだった
target: Then the assistant coach came and got me, and Dad patted me on the shoulder and then went to the car, and he never told me he was angry or anything.

source: それから　ドクに会った 俺が会った中で一番の肩を持った学生だったよ
target: Then I saw Doc, college kid with one of the best arms I've ever seen.

source: - 月を背にする
target: - Put the moon on our stern.

source: 決して檻に 背を向けるなよ
target: Don't ever turn your back to the cage.

source: 妖精たちもあなたに背を向けてきた
target: Loving fairies climb down your back

source: 壁に背を向けて立て
target: Over against that wall-- now.

source: 背中を向けて ゆっくりひざをつけ！
target: Face your back towards me! Slowly drop down to your knees!

source: このまま背中を向けて走っていれば 全員ペチャンコになる
target: If we keep riding with our backs to it, we'll all get squashed flat!

source: 胸に刻まれていたのは エノク文字だった
target: The Enochian runes that were carved in his chest --

source: ♪　鎖が胸を打つ　♪
target: ♪ my chain hits my chest ♪

source: 胸を痛めてる
target: Home. Mother's got a bit of a chest cold.

source: 僕たちは 空腹を抱え さらに説教を聞くために ラジューの家に向かった
target: So, to fill our bellies with food... and ears with more reprimands, we reached Raju's house

source: 覚えてる？ ぬり絵の時いつも 舌を出してたの
target: Do you remember how she used to stick her tongue out when she was coloring?

source: そしてあなたの舌を出す。
target: And stick your tongue out.

source: つまり　今の時代 舌を出したり 泡を立てたり 目立たなきゃ　始まらないの
target: I mean, nowadays you've got to... stick your tongue out or point a foam finger at your hoo-ha to get someone to even notice.

source: いいえ、運転免許を取ったばかりだけど、私が舵を取ってるのよ
target: No. I just finished driver's ed. Yes, of course, I can steer a ship.

source: 君が舵を取って、僕が撃つから
target: You steer, I'll shoot.

source: この肉体は　花を咲かせる為 これらの骨は 木々の根となる為
target: This flesh to nurture flowers... these bones to be roots of trees.

source: ママ いいか・・！ ・・お茶にしよう
target: Mum, look, how about that tea?

source: 気が変わるまで お茶にするわ
target: There's a cup of tea if you change your mind.

source: お茶にする？
target: Cup of tea?

source: 棺の蓋を開けろ
target: Get the lid off that coffin.

source: 蓋を開ける
target: Opening up the door.

source: 血液検査とX線よ　いい？ 蓋を開けた時 息子は・・
target: Blood work and an X-ray first, okay? When you opened it up, was he, uh...

source: まだ血が通うてるのはめっけもんじゃて.
target: You're lucky your blood's still flowing.

source: ２４時間も血が通ってないんだ
target: It's been without circulation for 24 hours.

source: あなたの血が通っている
target: And your blood runs through her veins.

source: 性病かどうか 血を見れば分かると 本気で思ってんの？
target: Do you really think that you're gonna be able to tell if you have an STD by looking at your blood?

source: 女は男より血を見るよ
target: Well, girls see more blood than boys.

source: 何故女の子が血を見たら倒れるんだ？
target: Why would a girl see blood and collapse?

source: 話が分かってない
target: You don't even understand the offer.

source: 衛星からの熱線映像だ 敵は赤くなってる
target: Thermal imaging from a satellite. The enemy's in red.

source: 全てが赤くなった
target: Yeah, everything went red.

source: 中の煙が赤くなるのは何か忘れてる時よ
target: The smoke turns red when you've forgotten something.

source: それはあなたに2本の足があって 赤ちゃんも居なかったらの 4時間おきに泣く子を ウォーカーの中には
target: Back when you had two legs and we didn't have a baby crying for walkers every four hours.

source: 逃げろ 足があるうちにな
target: Run while you still have legs.

source: 健康な足があるだろ？
target: You've got healthy young legs, haven't you?

source: 川に足を入れてみる？
target: Here. Watch where you put your feet.

source: 封筒には ウサギの足を入れた
target: So I put my rabbit's foot in that package.

source: それぞれに足を入れろ　エリック
target: One for each leg, Eric.

source: 私が左足を出したら 右足を引いて
target: When I go forward on my left, you're back on your right.

source: ボートから手や足を出さず 動物に餌を与えないでください
target: Keep your hands and feet inside the boat, and don't feed the animals.

source: 前足を出して
target: Get on your front foot.

source: 私たちの足を引っ張って止まった
target: Stop pulling our legs!

source: 彼らはあなたの足を 引っ張るだけよ
target: I'm pretty sure they were pulling your leg.

source: 手と足を洗うのは何故
target: Why do you wash your hands and feet like that?

source: 親友の足を運ぶのも 生活の為か？ この脇に抱えて こっちの脇にも？
target: Is it working for a living when I carried my best friend's legs under this arm, and the rest of him under this arm?

source: - 跡を追うんだ
target: - Can you follow him?

source: 痕跡を追って 位置を特定します
target: Each trace I run I get a new location.

source: "山の足跡を追うぞ"
target: We'll take the trail in the mountains.

source: インディアンは "血" を信じて 悪霊を保ってる 月に一度の儀式で 自身を切るんだ 霊を解き放つため
target: The Indians believed that blood holds all the bad spirits, and once a month in ceremonies they would cut themselves to let the spirits go free.

source: それから　若くて背の高い ラテン系の紳士が 銃身を切ったショットガンを持って 公園から走って来て
target: Then a tall, young, Latin gentleman come running out of the park holding a sawed-off shotgun.

source: 春が来れば雪も解け 峠の道が開かれる 春が来れば雪も解け 峠の道が開かれる
target: In spring the snows will melt and the passes will open.

source: 黄色いレンガは いつでも道が開けるの
target: Yellow bricks or not, give me the open road any day.

source: 大丈夫。 私はそれが最高だと思う 私はこれらの鍵を握っている 誰かが私を外出させるまで その戸口の
target: I think it's best I hold on to these keys until somebody lets me out of that fucking door.

source: 妻は... 家の側の公園にある 木が好きだった... 数年前雷が落ちた
target: Abby's favorite place... my wife, she... she really liked this tree, it was in a park by our house... a few years ago, it was struck by lightning.

source: 雷が落ちる
target: - Lightning strikes that tree.

source: ＜脳に埋めた制御電極に 雷が落ちた、って事故＞
target: With an electronic implant in her brain to control schizophrenia...

source: 炎は青くなり 彼の呼びかけに声が答えました
target: The flames turned blue and I heard a voice answer his call.

source: 肌と目が青くなってる
target: The blue skin... brings out your blue eyes.

source: 前の４８時間に魔法を使ってたら 肌色は青くなる。
target: If a spell has been cast in the previous 48 hours, the witch's skin turns blue."

source: 筋肉が音を上げてるぞ
target: See all those blow that muscles will give you

source: 頭から血が
target: Shit, it's on his head.

source: 父親の顔は 白くなり 目は 頭から飛び出すほど
target: And then his face turns white and his eyes pop out of his head.

source: ぼくの頭から離れてもらいたい。
target: You stay the hell out of my head.

source: 弾を頭に入れる
target: I'll blow your head clean off.

source: こっちに来て　頭を下げろ！
target: Stay with me! PIERPONT: Keep your head down!

source: 身を低くして 頭を下げなさい
target: Stay here and keep your heads down.

source: 頭を下げて！
target: Head down!

source: これで　頭を冷やして
target: You know, this one you really do have to ice.

source: 頭を冷やすのを忘れないで
target: Get a cold compress for that thing on your head.

source: - 君の尻の割れ目に頭を突っ込む！
target: And then I'm gonna jam my skull into the crack of your ass!

source: 便器に頭を突っ込むなんて ないから
target: I'm not putting my head in the fucking toilet.

source: 落書きさせた壁に 頭を突っ込むか？
target: Or am I gonna have to put your head through that fucking wall?

source: 顔を見せてくれ なぜここの人はみんないい顔なんだ？
target: Look at that face. Why does everybody in here have such great faces?

source: 笑顔を見せて
target: Come on, let me see you smile.

source: 頭を上げて顔を見せろ
target: Raise your heads. Show me your faces.

source: 敵兵に風穴を開け 鉛の弾を詰める
target: We shoot them full of holes and fill them full of lead.

source: 背中に風穴を開けろ
target: Put a big fat hole in his back.

source: 食えないだろ
target: You can't eat it.

source: ソーセージ以外は 食えないって本当か？
target: Is it true you can't eat other than sausages?

source: 紙は食えない
target: We don't eat paper for dinner.

source: 怖いよお 首が飛ぶかもだし
target: I've got a phobia of being beheaded, and heights!

source: お前の首が飛ぶ
target: But you're gonna lose your head...

source: スタークの首が飛んだときには俺はお前の捕虜だ
target: I was your prisoner when Ned Stark lost his head.

source: 縛り首にされました
target: He had been hanged.

source: 私が打ち首にした少年 -- - 知っているか？
target: The boy I beheaded- did you know him?

source: しかしドイツ人は吊るし首にしたがっている
target: But the Germans want a head on a spike.

source: 打ち首になるより ましだと思ってるだろう？
target: I suppose it is preferable to beheading.

source: 首を切られて 川に捨てられたそうよ
target: They say they cut her throat to the bone and threw her body in the river.

source: アイツはカタナで 人間の首を切ったのよ！
target: He chopped the guy's head off with a sword!

source: タワー・グリーンは　そこで アン・ブーリンが首を切られた
target: Tower Green is where Anne Boleyn was beheaded.

source: 馬の骨ってこと？
target: That means it's from a horse?

source: 馬の骨かも
target: Maybe it's a horse.

source: この中には ２人分の骨があるわ
target: We have two sets of remains.

source: 人間の手には ２７個の骨がある
target: In a human hand there are 27 bones.

source: 骨盤と大腿骨があるようね
target: This looks to be the pelvis and the femur bone of a common ground squirrel.

source: 3本　肋骨が折れて 脳震盪だ 医者は 元気になると言った
target: You've got a pneumothorax, three broken ribs and a concussion, but the doctor said you're going to be fine.

source: 頭蓋骨が折れてた
target: - My skull was fractured.

source: 首を絞められ 肋骨が折れてる
target: Elise Nichols was strangled, suffocated, her ribs are broken.

source: 雪が降りあんたの骨を埋めるのを
target: I saw the snow fall and bury your bones.

source: 骨を埋めてどうする
target: -Sorry,Doctor. -We're trying to take bones out of the ground, -not put mine in.

source: 本の説明では... 家の下とか地下室に穴を掘って 骨を埋める習性があると記述している
target: Says they usually dig pits to bury the remains under houses or in basements.

source: 自分の手の骨を折るほど強く あなたを殴った
target: She hit you hard enough to break her hand.

source: ハンマーで自分の骨を 折ったの
target: In her right hand is a large hammer she's been using to break her own bones.

source: 指の骨を折ることになるかもな。
target: I can't promise your fingers won't get broke.

source: わからん 鼻が利くんだ
target: I don't know, man. My nose was bleeding.

source: 鼻が利かない探偵さんか
target: You're a detective who can't smell?

source: 参考人は鼻を折られた
target: My client has a broken nose and a fractured cheekbone.

source: ヘスはそのかわいそうな男の 鼻を折ったそうです。
target: Broke the poor guy's nose, she said.

source: トニーは鼻を折って マクギーは脱臼
target: Tony has a broken nose.

source: お迎えが来ましたよ
target: Your ride's here, pal. Take him.

source: そろそろ、あんたにゃお迎えが来る頃なんだから
target: One of these days, you'll have to get your ass on a wagon and stay there.

source: それは　あそこへ行く ということか？
target: Do we have to go there?

source: そこへ行くと言ってた
target: - Texas? - He said he was going to Texas.

source: そう呼ばれていますね フェニックスでは
target: Isn't that what they call you, for example, down in Phoenix?

source: フェニックス紙を？
target: - Did you see the one in the Phoenix?

source: フェニックス基地で8時だ!
target: Tonight at Camp Phoenix at 8:00!

source: 中に入って... ドラムを叩けば... 分かるじゃろう
target: Go inside... bang the drum... and find out.

source: だが中に入っちまった お前のことが心配だった
target: Yeah, but I did go inside. I was worried about you.

source: - 全員、後ろから中に入って
target: - Everybody, back inside.

source: あの晩 雨の中に立って
target: I was standing there that night in the rain.

source: ああ、だが君も見ただろ 中性子ビームの中に立っていた
target: Well, you saw it yourself, standing in those neutron beams.

source: ドフィネ通りの ど真ん中に立ってみろ...
target: You know what's smack in the middle of Dauphine street...

source: 我々は事故の結果だと思っています。 あなたが念動力を得たのは。
target: We believe that somehow, as a result of the accident, you acquired some form of telekinetic ability.

source: 多分、彼は天候をコントロールできる能力を得たと思います。
target: I think he can control the weather.

source: 日光により何かしらの活動力を得ていることを裏付ける実験だ
target: These experiments tried to prove that they gain some kind of power from the sunlight.

source: 厄介になりそうだ
target: I got a feeling it's gonna get messy.

source: 彼女はおまんこで あたしは厄介になってんの
target: She is a cunt. I'm an embarrassment.

source: 事態は厄介になってきた
target: Things just got ugly.

source: もし死んでたら、 こんな悪夢は始まらなかった。
target: If he had, this nightmare would never have begun.

source: 始まらないさ
target: Don't start.

source: 君の求める人生は 絶対始まらない
target: The new life you seek never actually begins.

source: 正直言うとですね、レスター、 私の膀胱は今とても小さくなっていて、 それで... - あら、かわいそう。
target: Honestly, Lester, stay or go, but I got a bladder the size of a penny, so...

source: ジェイノス・スリント パイセル 小いさな評議会が日に日に小さくなっていく
target: Janos Slynt, Pycelle-- the small council grows smaller every day.

source: 君の悪性腫瘍は 80％まで小さくなった
target: Walt, your tumor has shrunk by 80 percent.

source: 待って、息が続かない
target: Hold on, I need to catch a breath.

source: 息が続かない！
target: I'm running out of air!

source: でも 息が続く間だけ
target: Although I can only do it while I'm holding my breath.

source: キミの手を取って... ボクの手に置く
target: I'd take your head into my hands.

source: ♪手を取りにやって来る♪
target: ♪ Come and take my hand ♪

source: 私の手を 手を取って！
target: My hand, take my hand!

source: 彼らはなぜ手を握るんですか?
target: Why are they holding hands?

source: ‐怖いなら手を握っていいよ ‐あなたがでしょ
target: - If you're scared, I can hold your hand. - Please, you're the scaredy-cat.

source: もし彼女が僕の手を握ってなかったら 本物だと思い込んだだろう
target: If she weren't holding my hand right now, I could swear this was real.

source: 手を繋いで
target: Hold hands.

source: 手を繋いでくんのも
target: Holding hands and all that.

source: まずは隣同士 手を繋いで下さい
target: I'd just like us to start... by taking each other's hands.

source: 我々とカブールまで行進し 再び我が国に神の旗を 掲げるのだ
target: They will march with us to Kabul and raise the flag of God over our country again.

source: 登り切らずとも 頂上に旗を掲げた
target: We didn't just climb it, we rammed our flagpole in the summit.

source: ガチャンと手錠を 掛けられれば どうなります まるで ロシア 皇帝の地下牢だ 自由の旗を　掲げた アメリカ法廷とは思えない
target: The clanging of shackles brings to our minds the dungeons of the czars, not the flag-bedecked liberty of an American courtroom.

source: 白旗を揚げて　避難だ
target: Time to wave the white flag and head for the bunker.

source: 家族なしでシリアに戻ること それは赤旗を揚げるようなことよ（危険）
target: Returning to Syria without them would raise a red flag.

source: 私の役目は旗を揚げることだけだ
target: The part assigned to me is to raise the flag.

source: ２人とも向き合って 横を向いてた
target: Which means the killer was also facing the victim.

source: つまり被害者は横を向いてた 助手席のもう１人の方です
target: Meaning the victim was turned and reaching toward the passenger.

source: ちょっと横を向いてくれる？
target: Can you turn your head to the side, please?

source: 私は緊張していますので、私は汗をかいています。
target: I'm sweating because I'm nervous.

source: 分からないけど、脈拍が上がった それに手に汗をかいてた
target: I don't know, but her pulse was elevated And her hand was perspiring.

source: 身体は毒を拒絶するためにがんばる 豊富に汗をかくことで 排便、嘔吐
target: Your body will strain to reject the poison by profusely sweating, defecating, vomiting.

source: 彼女、あなたを目を回しながら 睨んでいた
target: I mean, I've only seen her give you like a hundred eye rolls.

source: 通常は柔らかい 電流を流すと... 分子を並べかえ硬くなる
target: Regularly flexible but put a current through it molecules realign, it becomes rigid.

source: フランス語で「ひび割れ」の意味だ。 油絵に乾燥とともに現れて 時間の経過によって硬くなる。
target: It's French for the cracks that appear on an oil painting as it dries and it becomes rigid with age.

source: 卵はもろいのが 硬くなって
target: The egg was fragile and came out hard.

source: オレも 捨て身になってた
target: I'd given up on my body.

source: ♪青い鳥が飛び交い
target: Bluebirds fly.

source: 青い鳥が... 青い鳥が
target: "The blue bird..."

source: "私の美しい小さな青い鳥
target: My sweet bluebird

source: "私が頭が痛くても" "痛い顔したり" "声 出したり"
target: Even if my head hurts, no one knows until I cry.

source: 頭が痛いんだ！
target: My head hurts!

source: 頭が痛くて　医者に行って来た
target: My head hurts. I had to go to the doctor.

source: そのフィールドに立った 全ての男も女も 選手たちは　その場で 友好な競争の精神に 出会えるチャンスに感謝するのです
target: Every man or woman on that field is grateful for the chance to be there, to meet in the spirit of friendly competition, man against man, nation against nation, to test themselves without fear or rancor against the best the other side has to offer.

source: 指紋とか、網膜スキャンとか、写真とかが 何をもたらすかは覚えておこう これが未来の現実だ
target: So just keep in mind that what happens to you guys, for example, with fingerprints and retinal scans and photographs, that is what is going to happen to people in the future when they resist policy changes and when they try to protest

source: 神に小麦を感謝しよう... 小麦を主に感謝しましょう そのええと... 彼は...
target: Let us thank the Lord for wheat... and let us thank the Lord for the wheat that uh... he... has born from the earth with his own two hands... so that we who eat bread... have a lot of bread to eat.

source: 昨年 上院を通過し 討議を重ねてきた 憲法修正第13条の決議案ですが 本日我々は票決を行います
target: On the matter of the joint resolution before us, presenting a 13th Amendment to our National Constitution, which was passed last year by the Senate and which has been debated now by this estimable body for the past several weeks,

source: ニューヨークの専門家に証言させる為に 飛行代、ホテル代やいろいろだ
target: I could also tell you that I gotta fly that guy in from New York City, get him to testify, put him up in a hotel and all that kind of stuff, but you don't need to know that.

source: この朝入れた穴に 近づき、もしうるさければ、 音量が壁の反対側に伝わり
target: That hole you drilled in the wall this morning-- once we get over there, if we make too much noise, the sound waves will travel through the wall and get picked up by the sensors on the other side.

source: しかし 興奮は冷めやりません アンナがビジターとして初めて 在NY 入国管理局を通過 他のビジターもそれに続き 米国の地へ
target: But nothing can take away from the excitement... as Anna becomes the first Visitor to step through the New York gate beside me... leading the way for many to follow her onto American soil in days to come.

source: ギリシャの自由の為 勇敢なレオニダスと300人の言葉が 広まった 家より遠く離れて
target: For from Greek to free Greek the word was spread that bold Leonidas and his 300, so far from home, laid down their lives, not just for Sparta, but for all Greece and the promise this country holds.

source: そこで、北半球は太陽の方向に 傾いています 北半球がそのように傾く春と夏には 植物の葉が生え、二酸化炭素を吸収 します
target: And so, when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted toward the sun, as it is in our spring and summer, the leaves come out and they breathe in carbon dioxide, and the amount in the atmosphere goes down.

source: もしもナチスが 我が皇太子を狙撃したと知れたら 戦争行為とみなされるでしょう
target: If it were known that a Nazi fired at our Prince, that would be an act of war, a war many in the Reich would be happy to see but one our empire would almost certainly lose.

source: 全てフィルムの中に入ってる 名前も日付も全て ママがやったことも全部 一度だけそこでやるの 一度だけシアターで
target: And it was all in the film, names and dates and everything, everything that my mom was doing, and once it was out there, once it was in theaters, there's no way that they could suppress it.

source: 私の正体は近しいものしか 知らない秘密です それが漏れてしまうと 私の家族や友人が危険となり 彼らを通して犯罪者からの 報復の対象となってしまいます
target: My identity is a closely-guarded secret known only to a few, and if it were to get out, will endanger my family, my friends, and it would embolden my enemies to retaliate at me through them.

source: 犯人の イライアス・ハーパーは― 32人の FBI捜査官を含む― 数百人の命を 奪いました
target: Parrish still believes that Harper, the man the FBI claims is responsible for the deaths of hundreds, including 32 FBI agents, was actually just the fall guy for a terrorist mastermind who remains at large.

source: 彼はアナタに優しくしてくれた アナタを救けたと でも実態は
target: I know that you think that he was kind to you, that he saved you, but the truth is... he systematically pulled you apart, Brody... piece by piece until there was nothing left but pain.

source: 彼は航空電子工学の専門家の 娘を誘拐し − 強制的に 我々の信号を遮断する − 制御カードを作らせ −
target: He kidnapped the daughter of one of our avionics specialists, forced him to retrofit a drone with an alternate control card that severed its signal with our satellite, allowing Gibson to take over remotely.

source: 追って来るのを心配する必要は もうないってことだ チャールズは　彼の財産を 君とイヴェットに残したが 遺言書に　彼の婚外子達が
target: We know that Charles left his fortune to you and Yvette, but he failed to include language in his will that would exclude his bastard children from laying claim to their share of it.

source: 彼が感じていたことを 話したのか？ お前の事をただの 怖がりの少年だと 考えていた事を
target: He told you that he has always felt that way, that he thinks you are just a scared little boy who's afraid to be on his own because daddy never loved him enough?

source: 対先進軍隊用の 上級ドロイドを配備した
target: Not only have the Espheni resorted to espionage, as General Porter has pointed out, but they have been forced to deploy their superior terrain droids, usually reserved for more technologically advanced forces.

source: PRISM の様な秘密作戦、アメリカ人の生活の 隅から隅までを覗き見する秘密捜査があって それをアメリカの市民 誰１人として知る事が無い こんなものが自由ではないでしょう？
target: When you have secret courts, secret operations like PRISM, secret investigations which go into every spit and cough of every American's lives, without any member of the American public knowing about it?

source: そして こんな記事も見つけたの スペインの船乗りが ３年 遭難した末━ 弧島で救出された話
target: About the time Finn and I were ready to leave, we found this article about a Spanish sailor who was rescued off a deserted island after being shipwrecked for three years.

source: やって頂きたいことは 道を渡り 私のキーを見付けて頂きたいのです
target: And what I'm gonna need you to do is go ahead, cross the road and see if you can find my keys for me so that I can radio for assistance.

source: サメがクジラを追って 海岸沿いの広範囲に 集まっているとして 一層の警戒が必要であると 述べています
target: "Surfline" surfing spokesman Jeff Tripp said people should be very vigilant this time of year, as we've seen large gatherings of sharks in the waters following the whales along the coast.

source: だから 狂った理論がある 強力な秘密に 誰かがハッキングされて 機関で 工作員の誰がが作った
target: So I have this crazy theory that someone hacked into one of the most powerful, clandestine agencies in the world and created an employee who, up until yesterday, did not exist.

source: CDCの 汚染除去プロセスで使うUVは − その中で 除染過程 日焼けのように −
target: The UV frequency the CDC uses in their decontamination process essentially cooked the invisible ink like a... like a sunburn, making it visible under these conditions and these conditions only.

source: ♪ 永遠には続かない ♪ 続くものがあるかも知れない ♪ それは君を想う僕の気持ち
target: * nothing lasts forever * * but maybe some things do * * forever is the way I feel for you * * forever is the way I feel for you *

source: 私の次のゲストは、前者は アメリカの諜報術 誰が発言する勇気ました たちの疑惑の軍事同盟について 多くの人が記述内容とは
target: My next guest is a former American intelligence operative who has dared to speak out regarding our alleged military alliance with what many describe as a group of extraterrestrial mercenaries.

source: 彼の　くだらない記事を書いても
target: He's a two-bit TV actor... who won't be around any longer than it takes for the ink to dry on the pages of the worthless rags you jerk-offs write for!

source: 人類の為に、俺の血を抜いて 裏口から出て行ってくれ
target: Just take a couple pints of my blood to satisfy the masses and let me slip out the back door if we ever get the hell where we're going.

source: 人には2つのタイプがある 誰が試練にぶつかる - 経験から成長する人
target: Most people there are two types of people who go into a crucible-- the ones who grow stronger from the experience and survive it, and the ones who die.

source: デルタフォースは53秒 俺達なら40秒だ
target: Delta Force could do a mission like this in probably 53 seconds. But with our athletic superiority, we should be able to do it in about 40. All right?

source: 全国民が大統領の死を 追悼する一方... 捜査当局は 暗殺者発見のため... 歴史上最大の捜索を開始しました
target: As the nation continues to mourn President Spencer's death, the country's law enforcement agencies have launched the largest manhunt in history as they begin the search for the assassin.

source: お前には任務がある 家から遠く離れて... 見知らぬ町、見知らぬ人々に 見知らぬラーメン
target: You have a job to do... far from home, in a strange city, filled with strange people, and strange noodles, facing horrible danger from which you might never return!

source: しかも　トレントは　ほとんど独占的に 医師だと主張する男の訪問を受けていた その男が大人の食べ物を
target: We also know that Trent was visited almost exclusively by a man claiming to be a doctor, a man who I believe cut an adult's food into child-size bites.

source: でも中のタマネギは嫌いなわけ だからチップス使って タマネギを分離して グアカモーレだけをとるんだけど
target: But I don't like the onions in guacamole, so I take a chip and swirl it around and separate the onions from the guacamole so I can eat it.

source: 君の親愛なる友 マルセルが君に使った手とは 自分の命令に従わせること 君が屋根裏で腐ってるあいだ 孤独に
target: Your dear friend Marcel tricks you into doing his bidding, and all the while, you rot in an attic alone while young Timothy moves on with his life.

source: それぞれに裁判が開かれ、 教義の違反を構成するかもしれない行為に対して、 有罪かどうか判断されます
target: A trial will be held for each of them to determine if they're guilty of any acts that might constitute a violation of the tenets of the faith.

source: それから入場料をそっくり手に入れて 朝になったらすぐ郡の税務所に 届けなきゃならないんだ
target: Then we gotta figure out some way to collect that gate money, get it to the Cook County Assessor's office as soon as they open in the morning.

source: ロスキー家の夕食会に行く ドレスを着ていたわ パパの絵を見ている 自分を鏡で見ていたら... また怒りがこみ上げて来たの
target: As I was getting dressed for the Loskis' dinner party I found myself staring at the painting my father had given me and became furious all over again.

source: もっと前に気付かなかったとは 私が馬鹿だった ずっと塵の中を 探していたものが すぐ目の前にずっと有ったとは
target: I was a fool not to have realized it earlier, seeking all this time in the dust for that which may have been right before us all along.

source: - 早朝に行ってみなさい そして幸運の女神が微笑んだら 誰のために作ったのか 教えてくれるだろう
target: - Go and see them in the morning, and if luck has been smiling on your face, they should be able to tell you who they made it for.

source: いつか　自分の感じている 痛みに対して 「この痛みに限りはあるのか？ 」 と思うかもしれない
target: One day you might find cause to ask yourself what the limit is to some pain you're experiencing and... you'll find out there is no limit at all.

source: . ３人のエジプト王が建てた ギザのピラミッド. .
target: It's also called the Three Kings and the reason for that is the three Egyptian kings who built the pyramids in Giza built them to mear those stars.

source: 古い新聞を捜した。 ３７年の大地震のころ その数ヶ月前に
target: I surfed through the old newspapers, around the time of that big earthquake back in '37, and for several months before, there were a rash of murders.

source: 俺の行動を ふんぞり帰って　命令するだけの奴より 価値があるからだ
target: Because what I do amounts to more than just buttoning up a business suit and barking orders from a desk, hoping that people will take me seriously.

source: これで令状を取って スーパーの地下を掘り起こせなくなった 存在を示す確実な証拠もない - なぁ おい
target: Nobody's gonna give us a court order to jackhammer up the floor of that market looking for bodies when we don't have any evidence that they're there.

source: "フォックスキャッチャー"に 来て貰えないかと 会って話したいと
target: Mr. du Pont asked that you please consider taking a day off from your training to come out to Foxcatcher Farms, so you men can meet face-to-face.

source: マフィアが消え バルジャーは怖いものなし 俺達は泥沼にはまり 何も言えない
target: Now we're stuck with Whitey, and without the Italians, nobody can rein him in and we can't even pull on his chain because we're in too deep!

source: しかしすぐに、 砦の建造をおやめにならなければ オルハンをエディルネに送り、 スルタンの位につくよう、力を尽くすことになろう
target: But if you don't stop building the fort immediately I will send Orhan to Edirne and do all I can for him to take over your throne.

source: - 誰も彼らの主張を信じるとは 考えられ無い - - 彼らが現場で採取したという 彼らの主張に係わらず
target: I'll to have them thrown out, because we have no idea who has taken them although they claim, they were taken at the scene of the crime.

source: この世紀の発見に君の名は残らない 教科書に載るのは君じゃない
target: But you and I both know you're not gonna walk away from the find of the century because of whose name's gonna end up in the textbooks.

source: 力になれるか分かりませんが 教授に言われて来ました
target: Well, I don't know how much help I can be, sir, but Professor Mason did ask me to meet with you, and, well, here I am meeting.

source: そして４名の乗客の死亡原因が あなたの飲酒薬物にあるとすれば 殺意なき殺人罪に問われるでしょう
target: And if it is proven that your intoxication was the cause of the death of the four passengers, now we're gonna look at four counts of manslaughter.

source: 対テロリスト本部長は 警察が捜査を進めて 必ずテロリストを逮捕すると伝えてます
target: The chief superintendent and the head of the antiterrorist unit say the police are doing everything to catch the terrorists and that they already have several leads.

source: まだ誰を信用していいか わからない どこかにサブの局を作る 必要がある 大使館とは別の人間を使ってね
target: You don't know who you can trust yet, so you need to set up a second station somewhere, with your own people, independent of the embassy.

source: 別れて３週間たってから― 飛行機に乗ってさ
target: Rob literally broke up with her three weeks before we were supposed... to come out here and Natalie had to drag her ass onto the airplane.

source: 地震学者の警告は 続いています 世界中の構造プレートは サンアンドレアス地震のように
target: Seismologists will be keeping a close watch on all of the world's tectonic plates as the San Andreas quake could have rippling effects throughout the globe.

source: 僕が思うにー 彼が仕事について 話したくないのは 君を明るい所に 居させたいためだろう
target: I think that maybe if he doesn't want to talk to you about his work, it's probably because he wants to keep you in the light.

source: しかも俺がいかに天賦の才能と 受けた教育をムダにしたかを 説教したすぐ後に
target: That was right after he finished lecturing me on how I'd squandered my above-average intellect and my substantial education, all while he was standing there naked.

source: ひょっとして証拠が 流れて来てるかも この・・・ 下水に
target: I was wondering if any of the evidence from the crime scene might have washed its way all the way down the block to the... sewer.

source: 私の言葉を 受け入れろ 私の先祖と 審議会が合意した 1682年の ヴィッテンベルク憲章を援用する
target: And you need to take my word for it, because of what my ancestors and the council agreed to at the charter of Wittenberg in 1682.

source: チーズを語らずして　尊敬と権力の階級の 兄弟には　なれない。 チーズが　私に何をもたらすかは　関係ない。
target: Unless you are referring to how cheese brings men of respect and power together in brotherhood, no, I do not know what cheese does to me!

source: ２５の時に 一般市民９人の殺害に加わった 私の娘もそのうちの一人だった テキサス州エルパソの小さな教会・・
target: At twenty-five she did her part in the killing of nine innocent people, including my unborn daughter, in a small wedding chapel in El Paso, Texas.

source: それで　多分　あなたは 午前3時に 交通違反切符の支払いをした または多分　あなたは 散歩するつもりだった
target: So maybe you were going to pay a traffic ticket at 3:00 AM, or maybe you were going to take a walk on the Brooklyn Bridge.

source: あなたは私に伝えることが あるのでは ひどい研究所で 弟は調整させられていた 世界で最悪の伝染病因子を
target: Or maybe you'd like to tell me why my brother was tinkering with maybe the worst contagion this world has seen in his own damn lab?

source: 私の知識を教えるから 他の者に害を与えないと約束して
target: I will only give you this knowledge on the condition you do as I ask and promise that no harm will come to any soul.

source: 聞いていないのかしら 彼の父親はダーシー氏の 亡父の執事だったのよ
target: No doubt he forgot to tell you, among his other communications, that he was merely the son of old Wickham, the late Mr. Darcy's steward!

source: 私は気をそらす事は しません これは、多くの不順な事実と 比喩的表現です 皆さんは遠く離れた 詐欺を嗅ぎ分けれる事が出来ます
target: I wouldn't try to distract you with a bunch of random facts and figures of speech cuz you'd smell a fraud from a mile away.

source: これは認めなきゃ コンコーディアには 最先端の科学技術 それを間近で学ぶ機会が そして厳しい経済情勢下 実のある雇用創出が
target: You've gotta admit that Concordia, with cutting-edge technology, dynamic learning opportunities, and real jobs in a harsh economy is a home run for the visitors.

source: 俺と同じ体格だな 黒いシャツとパンツはかせて... レザージャケット着せれば...
target: Put you in a black shirt and dark pants... with a leather jacket... you'd look just like Emmet Myers, to anyone who never saw him.

source: 世話人は　一時的なものじゃない 彼ら自身　自分の中毒と闘い あなたを終生　支援し助言してくれる人物
target: A sponsor is permanent, someone who's... struggled with their own addictions and is gonna offer you lifelong support and advice, which is what you need.

source: シッドでベイグルを食べながら... ニューヨーク・タイムズの 小さな記事を読む そして...
target: I'm gonna be sitting there, eating one of Sid Meldman's toasted onion bagels, and reading a tiny article in The New York Times, page... 18,

source: あなた同様 ネットに投稿し オンラインで預金口座を 確認し 患者の機密ファイルまでも パソコンで保管していた
target: Like you, I posted on social media, checked my bank account balance online, even kept the confidential files of my psychological practice on my computer.

source: お前は自分自身が 許せなのは分かる アストラに起きたこと 犠牲を無駄にしたくないなら
target: Maybe you'll never forgive yourself for what happened to Astra, but if you want to give her loss some meaning, then do something about it.

source: そうできれば いいんだけど... 明日 制御室に 入れてあげる 舞台裏や色々よ
target: I really wish that I could, but... tomorrow I can take you into the control room... show you behind the scenes and all of that.

source: 委員会が あなたをどう思うか楽しみだ 我々の弁護団は言うまでもなく これが全国で直面する時
target: I'll be interested to see what the board makes of you when this is in front of the entire country, not to mention our lawyers.

source: 自分だけの人生ではなく 宇宙の中の永遠の生を 信じて...
target: We must believe that we're not only living now on this lump of earth, but that we have lived and shall live forever, in everything.

source: 君は最高の巡回セールスマンだ 私は君を現場に出すことに夢中なんだ
target: I'll be honest, Jim. You are one of our best traveling salesmen. I mean, I would be crazy to take you out of the field.

source: マスーカの言う通りだ 弁護士は紛失を確信しとる
target: Masuka's right. This is why Sirko's attorney asked for early discovery. He knew the evidence would be missing, we'd be left there holding our dicks.

source: 古代中国の、易経という思想体型は ６４時化に基づいています。 これは６本の線を基本とするシンボルで、
target: The ancient Chinese system of wisdom, called the I-Ching, is based on 64 hexagrams, symbols with six lines in a set, some coninuous, some broken.

source: そうね あなたはどこにも行かない 緊急な回答を 求めているわけではありません 第47項目の調査を開始します
target: Right, well, now that you are staying, we're not going to instigate an emergency response, but we are gonna begin an investigation under Section 47.

source: そして、彼らが欲しいのつもりだ ヨーロッパ人、アラブ人と同じ 誰もが、ニューヨークの不動産したい アメリカでは、私はここでは市場の知っている。
